Senora Juana is a humble woman who has run her small business for many years. Her small cafe sells juices and snacks, and she generates enough income to help her family cover some basic costs to survive. Even though Juana is getting older, she is still very motivated to work.

Señora muy sencilla trabaja hace muchos años en el rubro del servicico D. jugos, sumos y ensaldas D. frutas con la cual ayuda a su familia a cubrir los gastos necesarios para sobrevivir, la señora ya es D. edad avanzada, pero aun tiene muchas ganas D. trabajar.

loans.use: TO REPLACE THE OLD UTENSILS IN THE CAFE KITCHEN, AND PURCHASE NEEDED INGREDIENTS AND MERCHANDISE AT WHOLESALE PRICES.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty B. is a wife and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She is a thirty-one-year-old merchant who sells charcoal and smoked fish. Charcoal is a very popular source of heat for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes.

Through this business, Gifty has supported her first-born to complete junior high school. Gifty obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal and smoked fish to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to the group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more  charcoal and smoked fish for re-sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, a sus 49 años es madre D. 6 hijos, que ya son independientes, trabajan y siempre la apoyan, ella se siente muy contenta D. tener unos hijos tan colaboradores, auque no pudieron estudiar una carrera profesional, son hombres muy trabajadores, y eso es lo más importante para Maria. Ella se dedica a la venta D. postres (queques, piononos, acaramelados, etc.), que lleva a vender por diferentes lugares y cuenta con una extensa clientela. Ahora necesita adquirir varios pedidos D. sus clientes, por lo que solicita este préstamo, ya que quiere cumplir con todos, además D. adquirir un kiosco para la venta D. sus postres y dejar D. hacerlo D. manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Maria, aged 49, is the mother of six children. Her children are all already independent; they all work and always support her. Maria is very happy to have such cooperative children, and while they weren’t able to study to become professionals, they are very hard working, which is very important to Maria. She sells desserts (cakes, swiss rolls, toffee-coated cakes, etc.) in different locations and enjoys an extensive clientele. Now in order to meet the many orders placed by her clients, she is asking for a loan. Furthermore, she hopes to acquire a kiosk to sell her desserts in one location, as opposed to continuing to be a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more desserts to sell, as well as to build a kiosk

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Justina es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Justina vende quesos que adquiere en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Ayacucho de las personas que viajan a las ferias, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima en el mercado de abastos a donde viaja cada 15 días y dependiendo de la demanda.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Justina son tener un negocio estable, capital propio.
texts.en:
Justina is a partner of the Seagulls Community Bank. She is 31 years old and a single mother of two. Justina sells cheeses that she buys in the bus terminals of Ayachucho, from the people who travel to the markets. She sells the cheeses in Lima's supplies market, where she travels roughly once every 15 days, depending on the demand. Justina needs a loan of 600 soles, which she'll use to purchase cheeses. She dreams of having a stable business, with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Justina needs a loan of 600 soles, which she'll invest in the purchase of cheeses.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad es una persona muy responsable, vive en condiciones muy humildes junto a sus esposo y sus pequeños hijos, en un pequeño cuarto en una casa familiar, pagan mes a mes su alquiler de manera muy responsable. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil y aporta a la mantención del hogar con lo poco que pueda. A su vez la señora Felicidad trabaja muy arduamente para ayudar a la mantención del hogar mediante la venta de herramientas y material de ferretería de manera ambulante en las ferias, mercados y calles de la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia, con lo cual aporta tambien al hogar, es una señora muy dedicada a su familia y el dinero que reunan será destinado a comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a responsible person, who lives in humble conditions with her husband and small children. They live in a small room in a communal house and pay their monthly rent on time. Her husband works as a bricklayer and supports the family with what he can. At the same time, Felicidad works hard to help maintain the household by selling tools and hardware items at the fairs, markets and in the streets of El Alto, Bolivia. She is very dedicated to her family and the money she makes will be put towards purchasing their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Juana Alberta

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en casa propia con una D. sus hijas en la calle Cumana D. la zona D. Villa Nuevo Potosí D. la ciudad D. La Paz; tiene una tienda D. abarrotes ubicada en la Av. Buenos Aires, con esta actividad ella se mantiene y pueD. cubrir sus necesidades D. alimentación y ropa.  El crédito que solicita es para la compra D. más productos y tener su tienda con bastante stock  y D. esta manera no perder clientela  y mejorar sus ingresos.

El historial D. la señora es muy bueno por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente D. IMPRO desD. el año 2003.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home on Cumana Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone of the city of La Paz with one of her daughters. She owns a a grocery store located on Buenos Aires Avenue. With the earnings from her store she supports herself and is able to cover her needs for food and clothing. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more products in in order to stock her store well. This will assure that she does not lose clients and will allow her to improve her income. Juana's credit history is very good and qualifies her to receive a new loan. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Majaria

texts.en:
Majaria A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – four boys and two girls. She says that, currently, two of her children have completed senior high school and have yet to continue. Some are also in the high school while the rest are still in the basic school. Majaria’s husband is a watch repairman. She lives with her family in an old family house at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Offinso is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of the town are in official occupations.

Majaria trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy it in the local market where she sells. She has been in business for over ten years. She wants a loan to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Los Laureles 2 Group

texts.en:
Group 2 of the Los Laureles Bank of Hope is on its first loan cycle with Esperanza International. This group of small entrepreneurs has five members, with businesses in the sales and food fields. Several of the members, including Maria J., the group coordinator, have food stands. Others sell different products in small shops or at their own homes.

Maria has four children. She hopes to provide for them a better education so they can have a brighter future and better job opportunities. This is why she is taking this loan with Esperanza. She is looking for a fresh capital injection that will revitalize her business, allowing her to have more merchandise available for her customers and, in consequence, increase her sales.

These ladies are looking forward to the future, and know that their hard work will pay off. On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting this loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a food stand.

loans.name: Amou Yawa Digbodi

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier de soviépé et a pour activité le commerce de charbons de bois et de céréales, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, elle vend du charbons de bois en détail et en gros et parfois à crédit.étant seule dans sa zone, elle a une demande très elevée, elle voudrait par conséquent bien satisfaire sa clientèle. Ayant déjà obtenu un crédit de wages elle sollicite un second pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et de céréales. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est transitaire et elle a 03 enfants à charge.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Soviépé neighborhood, and since 2000, her business has been consisting in selling charcoal and cereals. She sells charcoal retail and wholesale, and sometimes on credit. As she runs the only business of this type in her area, she experiences very high customer demand. In order to meet such demand, she's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy sacks of charcoal and cereals. She's married to a freight agent and has 3 children to support.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa P. has been a member of Paglaum since 2000. She is married and has two children. She lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman and fishing is their income source. She dreams that her two children will finish their studies some day.

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fishing net and fishing gear. With enough savings, she also wishes to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and fishing gear

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is sixty-five years old. She is married and has six children. Currently, all her children are out of  school and independent. Rebecca’s husband is a farmer. Rebecca, her husband, and two grandchildren live in the  family home, in the town of Oda, in eastern Ghana. Most of the people of Oda are either farmers or sell agricultural products. Very few people have non-farming businesses. 

Rebecca is a baker and also sells in second-hand clothing. She buys fabric and second-hand clothes, including bed linens and men's and women's clothing, from Kumasi, a nearby city. She sells these items from a stand in the Oda market square. She also travels to nearby markets to sell her wares. Rebecca has been in this business for thirty-five years now and is asking for a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy fabric and clothing in bulk. 

She believes the loan would help her to expand to other market centers and eventually help improve her family's standard of living. She is a member of the “Ntoboase” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each other's loans and support each other in handling their repayment.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo produces and sells cellophane bags to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira (or about $350) to purchase more materials to make more cellophane bags. Taiwo is 47 years old and is a widow with 3 children. She thanks all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more cellophane bags

loans.name: Janaki

texts.en: Mrs. Janaki M. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.  Mrs. Janaki M. lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in grade 8.  Both Mrs. M. and Mr. M. are engaged in agricultural farming. They own their own land for farming. Mostly they grow green vegetables in their land. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. They fulfill all the requirements of the family by the income of their farming.   Now Mrs. M. is requesting for Rs 10000.00 loans to buy seeds and fertilizers for the farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una mujer de 53 años, nos dice que estar casada es la mejor etapa de su vida, ya que se siente realizada como mujer con su familia: su esposo y sus hijos. La venta de cosméticos en una actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años a raíz de la invitación de una amiga, quien la animó a ganar dinero a través de la venta por catálogo de productos de belleza. Desde entonces visita a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares para ofrecerles diversos productos; esta labor la realiza todas las tardes para ocuparse de su familia en las mañanas. Durante sus horas de trabajo distribuye sus pedidos y realiza las cobranzas, aunque su visión es trabajar con varias líneas de belleza para diversificar los productos y tener mayores oportunidades de venta. Desde que emprendió este negocio, María ha llegado a apasionarse por su labor, además los reconocimientos e incentivos que le dan las empresas de belleza la motivan para seguir adelante. Con Microfinanzas PRISMA ya tiene 13 créditos, siendo parte de su banco comunal, donde el trabajo en conjunto es una de las características de su grupo por lo que le agrada formar parte de él. María desea aprovechar las ofertas en los catálogos para adquirir varios productos, por lo que ahora solicita 2000 soles para ello.
texts.en:
Maria is a 53 year old woman, who says that being married is the best stage of her life, since she feels fulfilled as a woman with her family, husband and children. She has been selling cosmetics for the past 3 years after being invited by a friend, who encouraged her to make some money through beauty catalog sales. Since then she visits her neighbors, friends and family to offer various products. She does this work every afternoon to take care of her family in the mornings. During her work hours she distributes orders and collects payments, although her vision is to work with several different product lines to diversify the products and to have greater sales opportunities. Since she started this business, Maria has become passionate about her job, and the recognition and incentives that beauty companies give her have motivated her to keep going. With Microfinanzas PRISMA she already has had 13 loans as part of the communal bank, where team work is one of the characteristics of her group that makes her like being a part of it. Maria wishes to take advantage of the offers in the catalogs to purchase several products, so she is asking for 2000 soles for this purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Kenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Kenia de 29 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos, esta solicitando su 1er credito para mejora de vivienda, para construir los servicios higienicos ya que actualmente le falta, desea ademas construir su cocina ya que no cuenta con ella.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar, a pesar que es un matrimonio joven y sin hijos, desean tener las mejores condiciones cuando vengan los hijos estos se crien en un ambiente de comodidades.
texts.en:
Kenia is 29 years old, married with no children. She is requesting her first loan to improve her house, putting in bathroom plumbing since she currently doesn't have it. In addition, she wants to build a kitchen since she doesn't have one. She has the support of her husband that assumes responsibility for the household expenses. Despite the fact that they are recently married and don't have children, they want to have better conditions so that when they have children they will grow up in a comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of bathroom plumbing and kitchen

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Un, 50, (pictured with her children) and her husband, Mr. Thorn Uk, 54, live in a small village across the the Mekong River and about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of their children are in school, and the youngest one is three years old.

L. has been a silk weaver for twenty-nine years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder for nineteen years.

L. has borrowed money from Kiva through MAXIMA two times already and she used the loans to set up one more loom for her daughter to weave when she’s not in school. Now she is asking for another loan of $400 in order to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Tainratha Group

texts.en:
These people are members of the Tainrantha Group. They are (from right to left) M’Balu K., Memuna L., Abdul M., and Adamsay K. (with her small photo attached, she is a group member who was not able to be at the group meeting.  Her picture was taken during a later visit). They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town and have benefited from previous SMT loans. Previous SMT loans have made a lot of improvements in their lives and businesses. As a result of such loans, they were able to improve their businesses, make better sales and profit and consequently improve their standard of living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 4,200,000 to further strengthen their businesses.

Memuna L. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Memuna is approximately forty years of age. She was born in Lunar, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married in Magburaka town to a businessman and they have five children together. One of their children is now in college; the others are in secondary and primary schools. Memuna sells fresh fish and has been in this business for more than twenty years. With this loan, Memuna will be able to buy an additional two cartons of fresh fish. A carton of fish usually costs her Le 500,000 in Freetown.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa T., 47, is the mother of two children and a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till the wet field in 1985. All her work helped a lot with buying the daily needs of their home, including school payments and other projects. 

”Glory to God, my business is doing good,” she said. And now, she wants to increase the size of her farm. She wants to venture into something else like food to supplement their income. She needs a loan of Php 6,000 to buy farm necessities and start a new business. 

She withdrew from CEVI before but decided to rejoin. She realized that CEVI has the lowest interest rate and it offers not just credit but also insurance coverage.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine produces squash and string beans from her vegetable farm with the help of her husband. Her husband is a farmer and her business partner in earning a living for their family.

Josephine wants to request additional capital of PHP 10,000 for her vegetable-farming business. She will utilize the loan to buy fertilizers, hybrid seedlings, and other farm inputs that are very helpful for the growth of her crop and for it to become productive.

Josephine is 46 years old and is married to Hermogenes. They are blessed with four children and their youngest is the only one studying and she is already in college. They live happily in the simple place of Barangay Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela.

According to Josephine, patience is the key to success. Thus, she is hoping to be able to succeed in her business endeavor by working hard and by patiently enduring the difficulties of being a farmer and being poor.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, hybrid seedlings, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sasi

texts.en:
Sasi J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant  and is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs in her resturant.  Sasi is 25 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purpose.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more tables and chairs her resturant

loans.name: Perlicita

texts.en:
Perlicita is 36 years old and engaged in a sari-sari store business (community based store) located in their village at Sinamar, Roxas, Isabela. She is married to Roberto who is 41 years old and working as a farmer.

Perlicita wishes to improve her business by purchasing more stocks of merchandise for her store. Accordingly, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase different grocery items that are needed in her store.

Perlicita has four children and sending them to school is very costly. She hopes that, through her business, she can afford to send her children to school and hopefully have them finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase different grocery items that are needed in her store

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha P., 26 (not in the picture, but his wife is pictured instead), and his wife, Mrs. Thet Chay, 23, live in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. 

Vutha has been a motor taxi driver for over six years. His wife used to be a garment factory worker, but she now stays at home to take care of their children. Part of their house has fallen down so Vutha is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to make the repair.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred D. lives in the village of Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motorcycle repair business. The business is managed by her husband, and has been in operation for more than five years. Mildred earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Mildred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI. She has applied for a new loan of 7,000 PHP to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand and improve her company's operations. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada C. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Librada is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Librada owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling of variety of products such as soap bars, vegetables, seasonings and others in the local community. Librada has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Librada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Librada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Librada is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Librada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Yaye

texts.fr: Yaye S. est une dame de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle souhaite ce prêt pour s’activer dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires au marché. Les revenus qu’elle aura lui permettront d’assurer à sa famille la nourriture, le scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
Yaye S., age 54, is married and the mother of eight children. She would like to use this loan to sell food products at the market. Her income will enable her to provide for her family's food, schooling, and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell food products at the market

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio P. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Leoncio owns and operates a business providing motorcycle shop services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Leoncio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his business

loans.name: God Bless You Club #1 Group

texts.en:
Fatu J. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Bless You Club #1. She is 46 years old and is married. She has three children between the ages of nine and 25 - their educational levels are between the third and the eleventh grade. She also cares for some siblings. She is a high school graduate but could not continue her education due to poverty.

Fatu and her family live and work on Benson Street, opposite the A.M.E. Zion University in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Fatu’s business is the sale of food such as cooked rice, and drinks such as soft drinks and alcoholic beverages. She buys her food and drink items and sells them in a shop to residents in the Monrovia community. She has been running this business for 18 years and hopes to expand it to such a level that she would be able to own a restaurant in the near future.

Fatu started her business with 150 Liberian dollars as working capital, and she now operates with 100,000 Liberian dollars as working capital. She sells high-quality food in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Fatu needs this loan in order to purchase more food to serve her customers.  She dreams of getting a house of her own.

In the photo, Fatu is the one holding the sign. Nyenpu Y. is inset at the bottom right of the photo.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks for sale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K., age 28, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is a farmer who grows rice with her husband, earning an income of US $2.70 each per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2000. K. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more bananas and mangoes to sell to make more profit for the family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bananas and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia B. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Celia owns and operates a specialized retail business selling "RTW" or ready-to-wear clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Celia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Celia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Butogota Group E, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Hope, shown with hand raised in the group photo, is 43 years old and married with five children.

Hope has operated a bar and lodge in Butogota Upper for five years and, this being a rural area, she is able to make 150,000/- as monthly profits. Her other sources of income include the sale of tea since she has a tea farm as well as buying from other farmers and supplying the tea factory in her area.

However, Hope needs a loan to be able to buy more bedsheets and beers together with other drinks for her business so that it can prosper. Before her current business, she was a business lady selling produce but she says that her current business gives her more freedom and leaves her with more ample time for farming as her side income.

Hope’s dream is to expand her business and develop her family.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and beers plus bedsheets for her business

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria D. C. is a 34-year-old, married woman from the city of Balutu, Concepcion, Tarlac. She and her husband have 3 school-age children. Gloria is the group leader of a 5-member loan group administered via ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if one of them is delinquent or defaults on their loan.

To earn a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells goods to her fellow community members. Gloria has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, she was able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Gloria recently successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering. Gloria is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 8,000 PHP (though the total loan amount being sought by the group is 29,000 PHP, or $650), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and expand her working capital. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches, which cover the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing additional inventory and by expanding her working capital

loans.name: Satybaldieva's Group

texts.en:
Satybaldieva Z. is the 26-year-old leader of the group. A resident of Balykch, she is married to a bus driver and has a two-year-old son. A year ago her friends suggested that she rent a container, so with an initial investment of 15000 soms ($326.87) Satybaldieva started to sell children's sportswear and jeans As a result of this activity she increased her turnover on 23000 soms ($501.2$) and now earns nearly 15000 soms ($326.87) per month. Satybaldieva is now requesting a loan to purchase summer-autumn assortments of children's sportswear and Jeanswear.

Asankadyrova C., 36 years old, has two daughters and a son, two in school and one of preschool age. Her husband works in construction, and in winter he's engaged in buying and reselling cattle. Four years ago, C. sold her pavilion and with the initial amount of 60000 soms ($1307.47) she began her business activity, buying 2 head of cattle, 25 sheep, and a house. A loan is now requested to purchase a heifer and two sheep, which will be sold after fattening.

Bekturova Z. is the treasurer of the group. She's 49 and has raised two children a daughter and a son. Her daughter is a pupil, and the son helps her in selling the cattle. Z.'s husband works as a security guard, earning 5500 soms ($119.85) per month. Z. is requesting a loan to purchase two heifers in order to increase their livestock.

Ryskulov S. is 44, married, and has a 4-year-old daughter. Within the month his wife will begin to sell fruits and vegetables in the market. S. and his friend work in the market too, selling vegetables and earning 5000 soms ($108.95) per month. With the money received from the loan, Syrpay plans to purchase hosiery and children's clothes in order to resell them. In the future he wishes to increase the turnover, install a new gate at home and purchase a container.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: For puchasing clothes that will be resold

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 62 years old. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years already.

In 2007, Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Teresita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria D. C. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 33 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Maria owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells her raised animal. In 2009, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom U., 46, is a villager in Pump Edth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Seng Sok, is a construction worker who earns a little money to support his family. Although they work a lot, they earn a small income. To improve this condition, Mrs. Sokhom U. is applying for a loan to buy two piglets and pig food for breeding. She is the mother of three children: two are construction workers and one attends the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma L. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Erma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Erma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand ther business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa de unos parientes. Desde hace 2 años realiza bellos bordados, se inicio por invitación de una de sus amigas que la enseñó, ahora trabaja de manera independiente en la comodidad de su casa para poder atender su hogar y sus hijos. Asimismo cultiva alfalfa para poder venderla al por mayor, es por ello que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo. Pero es muy constante en la realización de sus bordados  ya que  por la complejidad de su trabajo y el grosor del bordado en la tela le quita un mes de trabajo, al final el resultado se a en una bella prenda típica que causa admiración entre sus clientes y finalmente son los que compran al contado. La época más rentable  en su negocio es cuando  están en plena época de festividades llamada “La fiesta de Santiago” que se celebra mucho por su zona. Desea crecer en la producción de faldas bordadas y contratar personal para ayudarla  en esta  producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. La razón de su crédito es para poder adquirir mas telas de diversos colores así como  hilos de diversos colores, también comprará semillas y abono para sembrar alfalfa.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in their relatives' house. For the last two years she has been making beautiful embroideries. She started when a friend taught her and she now works independently in the comfort of her home, which allows her to look after the house and her children. She also grows alfalfa to sell wholesale, which is why she does not have a fixed work schedule. However, she is very constant when it comes to her embroideries, as their complexity and thickness on the fabric take a month's work. The end result is a beautiful traditional garment, admired by her customers, who buy in cash. The most profitable period for her business is during the Feast of Santiago, which is widely celebrated in her area. She would like to increase the production of embroidered skirts and recruit more staff to help her. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial backing because she has always proved to be responsible in the management of her payments. She also enjoys being part of her loan group because all members are responsible and very supportive. She thanks those managing the loan request, which will be very helpful in the development of her business. She will use the credit to buy more fabrics and yarns in different colours, as well as seeds and fertilizer for planting alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics and yarns in different colours.

loans.name: Con Esfuerzo Se Crece Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Con Esfuerzo se Crece” (With Effort there is Growth) consists of 15 associates from the city of Viña del Mar. These individuals dedicate themselves primarily to the production and sales of salads, vegetables, bread, empanadas, perishable and non-perishable items, clothing items, and requested orders.

Paola, photographed in the first row, third from left, wearing a plaid black and green jacket, is the treasurer of the group. For the past six years she has sold clothing for men, women, and children from her house. A week before the end of each month, Paula travels to Santiago to purchase merchandise. She will use the loan to purchase clothing and intends to save her earnings to eventually purchase land and build a house. Paola dreams of one day having her own house and adjacent to it a clothing store. Her motivation is to ensure the education of her children, a 15-year-old son and an 8-year-old daughter.

Paola enjoys working with Fondo Esperanza, as she has established a good relationship with her loan officer and fellow borrowers.

Viña del Mar is a city and community located in the central coastal region of Chile, known as the "Garden City" because of its beautiful parks and gardens. Viña del Mar is in the Valparaíso region, known for its temperate climate. This region is known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To purchase women's, men's, and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N., age 41, is the group leader for the loan group. She was selected by its five members. All of the group members live in Preaek Samraong Village, Takeo Province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living of their family.

Mrs. Chantha N. is a vegetable seller in the local market. She is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support this business, she will use the loan from AMK to buy more vegetables to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Lay, is a construction worker who is also able to earn a small income to support his family.

This couple has six children. One is a construction worker, one is an iron welder, and one is a vegetable seller. Two of their children are students at the local school, while the smallest, age 5, is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ashi's Group

texts.en:
Ashi lives in a city called Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 

She is 23 years old and married with three children. Her husband's name is F. M.  and he is a private entrepreneur operating a clothes-selling business. Her older son has started attending school and is in kindergarten. The other kids are still too young to attend school.  

Ashi is a very caring lady. She prefers to spend her time at home taking care of her house and family. She has a set routine of getting up early in the morning, preparing breakfast for the family and getting her son ready for school. 
 
Her husband buys clothes from the famous markets of Lahore, named Ichra and Anarkali, and sells them to different other markets and in the community for a good profit. He has been doing this business for over six years. 

Ashi has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy clothes in bulk quantities and increase his selling. Ashi is hopeful that her husband will be able to make good income by utilizing the loan money in a positive way. She is a new loan applicant and is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the group member Parveen is showing her sewing business by working on a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy clothes for reselling

loans.name: Yendoukoua

texts.fr: yendoukoua est un jeune homme très dynamique, très tôt il s'est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées, il a ouvert sa propre boutique qu'il appelle "ETS YENDOUKOUA". il s'approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé.sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il veut se réapprovisionner, il demande chez WAGES un crédit pour compléter ses économies et acheter diverses pièces détachées d'automobile. il est marié et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en: Yendoukoua is a very energetic young man. Early on, he became involved in the spare parts business, opening his own shop which he calls "ETS YENDOUKOUA." He gets his supplies from the local market at the Port of Lomé. His clientèle is made up of many different types of people. As he wants to re-stock, he is asking WAGES for a loan to increase his savings and to buy various spare parts for cars. He is married and is the father of two children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Anastancia

texts.en:
Anastancia is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for five years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, bananas and nappier grass, which are all sold locally. She also owns a workshop business for carpentry and is also a tailor. Her primary challenges in farming have been lack of organized markets. Sometimes no sales are recorded and labor supply sometimes becomes a problem, leading to losses especially when the demand is high.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children and she will be able to provide her family with enough milk for their own consumption. In future, she would like to expand her business to enable her to buy a vehicle. She will use it to transport furniture from her workshop to her customers.

Anastancia is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10, who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita D. M. is from the village of Calao East Santiago. She is 39 years old. Melita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling deep-fried banana-que and other snacks. Melita has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Melita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Melita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Amarzaya Z. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Byamba’s wife stays home while the older two daughters attend a local secondary school.  He used to work as a herder in the countryside with 180 livestock. 

At first, he started his business in 2006 by operating a raw materials trading business.  Since 2008, Amarzaya has been operating a car repair business in his town.  Now, he plans to run a taxi service using his car.  In the future, he hopes to buy his own house and therefore he plans to start saving money from now on.  Amarzaya is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to pay for half of the car's purchase price.

loans.use: To pay for half of the car's purchase price.

loans.name: Houng

texts.en:
Mr. Houng L. and his wife, Mrs. Phon Prum have been married since 1983 and have nine children — seven sons and two daughters. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Houng and his wife are farmers. He is also a fisherman. When the harvest season comes, the couple sells their produce to a middleman in the village so they do not need to travel to Phnom Penh to sell any more. 

Houng is a asking for a loan of $200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama K. sells maize, charcoal and firewood in Takoradi. She is a widow caring for five defendents. She is responsible for the welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of charcoal to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses N. is 47 years old and married with seven children who are now between the ages of 1 and 22. Four of the children attend school.

Moses is a farmer in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and employs one farm hand. He sells his maize, beans, tomatoes, coffee, tea, milk and bananas to the local market. He also works as a casual laborer with a local cooperative society. He faces the challenge of diseases that affect his production.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He would like to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vecinos Victoriosos Group

texts.es:
Jackeline Margot, tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en La Zona de la Flor, distrito de Carabayllo. Hace cinco años integra el grupo “Vecinos Victoriosos” de 9 integrantes quienes la eligieron como Presidenta del grupo.  Empezó con su negocio hace ocho años, como vio que no había bodegas decidió poner su propia bodega, comenzó con pocos productos pero poco a poco fue creciendo y aumentando su mercadería con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Su anhelo más grande es concluir la construcción de su casa para ampliar su negocio. 
Con el préstamo solicitado, invertirá en la compra de bebidas.
texts.en:
Jackeline Margot is 37 years old, married and has two children, they live in the Flor area, district of Carabayllo. Five years ago she joined the “Victorious Neighbors” group, which is made up of 9 members who chose her as president of the group. She began her business eight years ago since she noticed that there weren’t any stores and she decided to start her own. Jackeline started with a few products but little by little her business grew and she began to increase her merchandize with a lot of work and dedication. Her biggest wish is to finish building her home to expand her business.

With the loan, Jackeline will buy beverages.

loans.use: To buy beverages and alcohol for her business.

loans.name: Deggo Book Ligguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO BOOK LIGGUEY est créé depuis trois ans. Il est composé de 09 femmes. Ces femme prône l'entente au sein de leur groupe. C'est ce qui leur a permis d'être très proche et son complice également dans leurs activités de façon général. Elles s'investissent toutes dans le petit commerce, achètent les produits au même endroit et fixe les même prix de vente.

Madame Marie Boya D. à droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. 

Elle s'active dans la vente d'huile de palme, de balaies, de citron. 

Les prêts qu'elle a contracté au près de CAURIE-MF lui ont permis d'étendre son marché vers la capitale du pays (Dakar)

Elle participe mieux dans la prise en charge de l'éducation de ses enfants. Elle soutien également son époux dans les charges familiales de façon générale.
texts.en:
The Deggo Book Ligguey solidarity group was created three years ago. It is composed of nine women. These women advocate harmony within their group, and this allowed them to feel very close and cooperative in their business activities. They have all invested in small stores, buy their products in one place and set the same price.

Mrs Marie Boya D., standing right in the picture and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of four children in her care. She sells palm oil, brooms and lemons. The loans she was granted so far by Caurie Microfinance enabled her to expand her activity right up to Dakar, the capital of the country. Now she participates more in the education of her children. She also supports her husband with general household expenses.

loans.use: To expand and promote her small business

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay S., 48, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband grows vegetables to sell, also earning an income of 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 18 USD on food and 49 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a new motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family's use.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. has been selling smoked fish for 10 years in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi. 

She received a junior high school education. She is married to a farmer and they have four children. Her income helps pay for school fees and utility bills.

To expand her business, she will use her loan to purchase extra fresh fish so she smoke a larger quantity. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente. Viven en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, en especial las ovejas. Cría los animales en un terreno cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. Con esta inversión, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. También piensa en usar una parte de su crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir para su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old; she is single and has one dependent son. They live in the district of Las Lomas -- an agricultural area located in the Piura province, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, Rosa has been raising and commercializing farm animals, especially sheep. She raises her livestock in a yard near her house, and when they reach a good level of development, she offers them for sale to general public as well as to the merchants that visit the area where she lives.

Rosa has an established client base in the neighborhood. She would like to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed. She would also like to increase the size and weight of her animals in order to be able to sell them at a better price. 

This investment will allow Rosa to increase her income and to keep investing in her business; she is also thinking of using a part of her loan to purchase clothing for her family. For these reasons, Rosa has decided to seek a loan of 700 soles (Peruvian currency) from  Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Ruth es docente y trabaja en el colegio de comunidad de Huallacocha, ella enseña en el nivel primario desde hace 11 años. Ruth también se dedica la distribución de comestibles y distribuye a tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de comestibles y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Ruth requiere el microcrédito para comprar comestibles.  El sueño de Ruth es tener una propia tienda de ventas comestibles.  

Ruth es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Ruth was born in Cusco Province in the Department of Cusco. She is 36 years old and lives in the city of Izcuchaca. Ruth is married and has four children.

She is a teacher who works at a school in the community of Huallacocha. Ruth has been teaching at the elementary level for eleven years. She also sells food products and distributes them to grocery stores. Ruth has been selling food products for many years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a microloan to buy groceries. Her dream is to open her own grocery store.

Ruth is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The phrase “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” means “Women Who Work” in the Quechua language.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shaigul's Group

texts.en:
Shaigul B. is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 years-old and married. She is a resident of Kochkor, a small village in Isykul region. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and a son. The daughters are married and live separately with their families. The son is 10 years-old, he studies at school. Shaigul and her husband are farmers. They cultivate agricultural products and breed livestock animals. The family has been doing it since 1991. Shaigul applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel, which is needed for the sowing process. In the futurem she wants to improve her family’s living condition. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers, as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Zephania

texts.en: Zephania is a 36-year-old married man with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in secondhand shoes for four years. He started with a capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. His hardship is lack of enough capital and his vision is business expansion plus building a better house. Zephania needs the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia forma parte del banco comunal “Belén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, vendiendo ropa para adultos y niños. Su mercadería es ropa nueva y la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Valparaíso, ya que los precios son a bajo costo. Julia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 26 años. Su horario laboral es de lunes a sábado de 8ºº a 18ºº horas y su puesto está ubicado afuera de una fuente de soda.
Con el préstamo comprará ropa de hombre, mujer y niño. Además  invertirá en materiales de construcción para la reparación de su casa, ya que ésta fue asolada por el terremoto del 27 de febrero del año 2010.
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, para esto Julia ya está realizando los trámites y gestionando un terreno. Sus motivaciones son principalmente por su salud, debido al sacrificio que se debe realizar al  trabajar en la calle durante la temporada de invierno, sobretodo Julia quien sufre de malestares en el brazo y el frío le afecta sus dolencias, es por esto que además se someterá a una intervención quirúrgica.
Julia vive junto a su esposo y tiene 2 hijos quienes están casados.
Ella está agradecida del crédito y la oportunidad que le ha entregado Fondo Esperanza para emprender en su negocio.
Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy amenas y comparte con las demás socias.  
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Belén” (Bethlehem) communal bank belonging to the city of Valparaíso.  She is a street vendor; she sells clothes for adults and for children.  Her merchandise consists of new clothes that she buys from distributors in the city of Valparaíso because the prices are low.  Julia has been in this occupation for 26 years.  Her work schedule is Monday through Saturday, 8-6 and her stand is located outside a soda fountain.

She will use the loan to buy men’s, women’s and children’s clothes.  Also, she’ll buy building materials and supplies to do some home repairs because it was damaged by the February 27, 2010 earthquake.

Her goals are to set up a business in an established locale and Julia is already doing the paperwork and negotiating for the land to do so.  Her motivations are primarily her health because going out to sell in the streets in the winter requires quite a sacrifice and Julia has problems with an arm and the cold exacerbates her condition.  Because of this she will be having surgery.  Julia lives with her husband and she has two married children.

She is grateful for the loan and the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has delivered to start her business.  With respect to the meetings, they are quite pleasant and she shares with the other members.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is a regional capital and the seat of the national legislature.  It is the nation’s main port and it has a variety of beautiful and picturesque places like, for example, Nobel Prize winning poet Pablo Neruda’s house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Luisa Martha

texts.es: La señora Luisa Martha  tiene 41 años D. edad, sólo ha estudiado la primaria, tiene cuatro hijos dependientes D. 18 hasta los 6 años, en edad escolar, vive a 8 km D. la ciudad en la zona D. Maica Sud necesita capital D. inversión, para arriendo (alquiler) D. terreno para siembra D. alfa y pastos para su actividad, no tiene suficiente espacio para sembrar en el terreno que ocupa su granjita, la misma que es D. tradición familiar D. cria D. ganado vacuno y producción D. leche cruda.  Quiere mejorar sus condiciones D. vida para toda la familia.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz y sólo viene dos veces al año a ver a su familia.  Ella lleva sola la actividad y el cuidado D. los hijos.
texts.en: Luisa Martha, 41, only completed elementary school.  She has four dependent children who are between 18 and 6 years of age, all school age.  She lives 8 kilometers from the city in the Maica Sud zone.  She needs investment capital to pay to lease land to plant alfalfa and grasses for her business.  She does not have enough space to plant on the land where she small farm is located which, following family tradition, is used to raise cattle and to produce raw milk.  She wants to improve the living conditions for her entire family.  Her husband works as a bricklayer in the city of Santa Cruz and only comes to see his family twice a year.  She carries sole responsibility for the work and the care of her children.

loans.use: to pay land leasing costs to plant alfalfa and grass for her cattle.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 35 years old and lives in Sigamok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Luz has a business selling dried fish in different store locations in town and in the public market. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this work. Luz has requested a loan to purchase dried fish.

Luz has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, Luz would like to have her own dryer so that she can purchase more fish and dry them on her own.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish

location.town: Liloy-Sigamok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саид житель Шахритуского района. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей находятся в России на заработках. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. В этой области Саид уже более 6 лет.
texts.en: Said lives in Shahrituz. He is 49 years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a housewife. Two of his sons are working in Russia. He makes a living by raising cattle. He fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase their numbers.  Said has been doing this for more than six years.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly, a 45-year-old resident of the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda, is single and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For over 10 years Milly has operated a business selling beans and rice, and she also has rental houses.

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase beans and rice to stock for resale in order to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Milly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to stock for resale.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Everlita has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Everlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Everlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 44 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual  es propia y cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Santos labora desde hace 6 años realizando servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente hasta las 6 de la tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para realizar mantenimiento a su mototaxi que está presentando algunas fallas, al encontrarse su unidad móvil en buen estado podrá brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y esto permitirá aumentar sus ingresos.  Santos es un padre de familia que con esfuerzo y trabajo a sacado adelante a su familia poco a poco, con la idea de que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his family. The only service he receives is electricity. Santos resides in the urban section of the District of Olmos, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. The residents of this district engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

For the past six years, Santos has been providing public transportation services using his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that is used for traveling short distances and has a maximum occupancy of three people). He works every day until 6pm. With the income he generates, Santos is able to cover his expenses and his family’s needs.

Santos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN through its Seed Capital Program. The money will be used to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi which is experiencing some mechanical failures. Santos needs for his vehicle to be in good condition so that he can provide excellent service to his customers and increase his earnings.

He is a father who is able to gradually move his family forward with the intention of providing his children a better future.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking and active 29-year-old business lady.  She is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. Since the year 2010, she has been rearing poultry to make a living. Previously, she used to work as a beauty specialist. 

In the next five years, she wants to have a large number of chickens and to be a distributor of eggs. Her dream is to rear livestock in the future. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chickens and layers.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy was born in 1973 and lives in Nhoi Duoi village with her husband, who works in construction, and her three children. She supplements her family's income by running a hardware store where she earns about 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. She joined SEDA in 2007 as a way to improve and expand her business, and has already taken out and repaid her first loan. Now she is applying for a new loan for 8,502,000 VND to buy construction equipment.

loans.use: to buying construction equipment.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 47 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngoc's husband earns money as a driver. Ngoc supports her family by sewing packing bags at her house. Ngoc would like to take a loan to buy a sewing machine to increase her production.

Ngoc hopes her business runs smoothly and that she will help to improve her family's living conditions and provide her daughter with a good education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to increase production

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es: Jannet, D. 37 años, está casada con Valerio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 D. ellos, a los que educa y cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Cajas. DesD. que era niña, sus padres le enseñaron el hermoso oficio del tejido hecho artesanalmente, desD. ese entonces hasta el día D. hoy se convirtió en su principal pasatiempo y forma D. trabajo. Ya tiene 4 años D. experiencia, tiempo suficiente para abrir una pequeña tienda donD. venD. prendas, como: boinas (especie D. gorra), chompas, ponchos y chalinas D. toda variedad. Según cuenta, todos los meses D. febrero, julio y octubre; los turistas visitan el “comercial artesanal”, donD. se encuentra la tienda D. Jannet, ahí obtiene buenas ganancias por la demanda que tiene.  Además hace poco incursionó en la venta D. ropa D. bebe, como colchas, frazadas; asimismo chompas para adultos en la ciudad D. Oroya, donD. viaja los días lunes y jueves.  Ahora su principal objetivo es incrementar su capital D. trabajo, para poder invertirlo en su tienda D. artesanía. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Talarmachay” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. espera del apoyo D. todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas.  Jannet D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. chompas D. toda variedad, así como la compra D. ropa D. bebé para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jannet, 37, is married to Valerio and they have four children, two of which still live at home.  They live in their own house in the town of San Pedro D. Cajas.
