Ever since she was a little girl she learned from her parents the beautiful craft of hand-knits.  Since then she has turned it into her main pastime and means of income.  She has four years' experience in her small shop where she sells a wiD. variety of garments such as caps, sweaters, ponchos and shawls.  

She says that in the months of February, July and October the tourists visit the "comercial artesanal" (crafts shopping center) where Jannet's shop is located.  She earns a good profit from the high demand.  Also, not too long ago, she began selling infant clothing, bedspreads and blankets, as well as adult sweaters in the city of Oroya where she travels Monday through Thursday.  Now her main goal is to increase her work capital to invest in her craft shop.  She belongs to the communal bank "Talarmachay" and this is her sixth loan through MFP.  She hopes she can count on your support to carry out her goals and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Jannet will use the loan to buy a variety of sweaters and infant clothing.

loans.use: To buy a variety of sweaters and infant .

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is an embroidery expert. She crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes according to the latest trends and fashions and supports her family financially with the earnings. Her husband is a mason. He works on a contract basis. 

Farzana is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her sons have a glass items selling business. People give them orders to make glass items like windows, doors and tables for them. Her daughters help Farzana in finishing her embroidery orders on time. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sons' business. With the loan they will purchase glass in larger quantity to finish the orders on time and earn maximum profit. They have been operating their business for the past 10 years and Farzana is hopeful that an investment will be profitable one for them. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy glass for glass item fabrication business.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely tiene 24 años, convive con Orebe de 28 años, con quien tiene 02 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Sivia. Nely es una mujer con mucha trayectoria en el negocio, que desde muy joven incursionó en el rubro de servicio de mecánica, vendiendo repuestos y autopartes, es ahí donde ella vio un buen negocio y por el que le resultaría rentable. Gracias a las buenas ganancias que obtenía, decidió que mejor sería ella quien se encargue de reparar los vehículos. Desde ese entonces se puso a estudiar la carrera corta de  mecánica automotriz, dejando el negocio encargado a su querido esposo, quien la apoyo bastante hasta poder culminar su estudio. En la actualidad ella es quien soluciona los problemas que tiene los conductores y lo hace muy bien, que hasta ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes potenciales. En un futuro próximo ella piensa especializarse en la carrera. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas. Ella esta agradecida a los de su banco comunal por fomentar el ahorro y el desarrollo. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más repuestos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Nely is 24 years old and lives with Orebe, who is 28 years old, and with whom she has 2 children.  Together they live in their own home, located in the district of Sivia.  Nely is a woman with a lot of experience in her business.  Since a very young age, she entered in the auto service industry, selling replacements and auto parts.  It is there that she saw a good business and that it would turn out profitable for her.  Thanks to the good profits she made, she decided that it would be better if she was the one in charge of repairing the vehicles.  Since then, she began to study the career of automechanic, leaving the business in the care of her beloved husband, who supported her a lot until she could finish her studies.  Currently, she is the one who solves the problems that drivers have and she does it very well, already having a number of potential clients.  In the near future, she is thinking of specializing in her career.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and for this reason, she promises to make her payments on time.  She is grateful to the members of her communal bank for promoting savings and development.  With the 1500 soles that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of spare parts to supply her business.

loans.use: to purchase replacement auto parts.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is a 40-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She has owned a clothing shop since 2002. She sells only women's clothes. With her business income, she is able to support her father with the family expenses. Today, she’s asking to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the new winter clothes collections. She notes that women are very trendy and these new clothes will help her increase her sales by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to also sell men's and children's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter clothes collections

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Llacao que se encuentra situada al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca. Su nombre se origina del vocablo quichua “llacar” que significa "el desprendimiento del choclo", y del sustantivo “cau” que significa "choclos a punto de desmembrarse". Llacao significa: desprendimiento de choclos en tiempo de cosecha.  Su gente es amable y se dedica a  la elaboración de artesanías como: sombreros de paja toquilla, cestería y cerámica decorativa.

Doña María tiene 61 años, es madre soltera  de 2 hijos que son mayores de edad y  casados,  uno vive independiente y su hija vive en su casa con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que vive es de propiedad.

La Señora. María labora en un mercado de la ciudad, en donde se dedica a la venta de granos secos, lleva 30 años en este negocio y labora de domingo a domingo sin ningún horario. En su casa tambien se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos. 

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es salir adelante y crecer más en sus negocios.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Sociedad 12 de Abril” communal bank.  She lives around Llacao Parish located in northeast Cuenca.  Its name comes from the Quechua word “llacar” which means “releasing corn” and the word “cau” which means “corn about to be separated.”  Llacao, then, means the removal of corn at the time of harvesting.  Its residents are kind and work making crafts like straw hats, basketry and decorative ceramics.

María is 61 years old and a single mother of 2 children who are married adults now.  One of them lives independently and her daughter lives with her and shares household expenses with her; the house she lives in is her property.

María works in a market in her city selling dry grains; she’s been in this business 30 years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  At home, she raises pigs and chickens to sell.

This is the second loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she will use it to buy pigs and pig feed.  Her goal is to get ahead and to grow more with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 36 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Lorena has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sewing materials like needles, threads, seam rippers, etc.

Lorena has been in this business for 5 years. Lorena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like needles, thread, seam rippers, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: La señora Amparo a sus 40 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad. La señora Amparo tiene una tienda desde hace aproximadamente dos años; esta labor la inició la señora Amparo luego de trabajar por siete años en una fábrica de arepas y querer independizarse para mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejorar la calidad de vida a sus dos hijos. La señora Amparo trabaja sola en su tienda de lunes a domingo desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 de la media noche. La señora Amparo desea comprar surtido para su negocio tal como gaseosas, snacks, aceite, productos de aseo personal y duces, con lo cual pueda atraer más clientes e incrementar sus ventas. El sueño de la señora Amparo es comprar su propia casa y ver a sus hijos siempre felices.
texts.en: Amparo, 40, is the mother of two children aged 16 and 18.  Amparo has had a store for about 2 years.  She started up this business after working for 7 years in a factory in Arepas.  She wanted to become independent in order to improve her income and provide a better quality of life to her two children.  Amparo works alone in her store every day from 8am until midnight.  Amparo wants to buy merchandise for her business such as: soft drinks, snacks, cooking oil, personal care products and sweets, so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales.  Amparo dreams of buying her own house and of seeing her children always happy.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina, 30, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Rina her husband sell food. Rina is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice. In the future, Rina would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Martha le había estado realizando mejoras a su vivienda con ahorro propio, pero como hace unos meses se quedo sin empleo dejo a mitad el cuarto de sus hijos, pero ahora que volvió a trabajar esta solicitando un crédito para poder ponerle el vitropiso la recamara. 
Doña Martha esta separada del padre de sus hijos, pero Ella solo se encarga de los gastos de la casa y la pensión que le da su ex esposo son para los gastos escolares; por lo cual señora Martha trabaja  en un fabrica y con este ingreso podrá darle a sus hijos lo que necesitan y mejorar el patrimonio.
texts.en:
Martha has been using her own savings to make improvements to her home.  A few months ago she was left without employment, and that left half of her children’s room.  However, now that she is working again, she is requesting a loan to be able to put down a tile floor in the bedroom.

Martha is separated from the father of her children.  She alone is in charge of the household expenses.  The alimony that her ex-husband gives her is for school expenses. 

Martha works in a factory, and with this income she will be able to give her children what they need and improve their legacy.

loans.use: to put down tile in a room.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a humble person with a strong personality. Even so, he’s cheerful and very hardworking. He lives with his wife and three children in Villa Concepcion, province of Isabela.

Arthur works raising pigs, a business he started one year ago. He started raising pigs and as they grew he’d sell them.Now, he needs to increase his business and this is why he’s taking out this loan that he will use to buy hog feed, vaccine, vitamins and additional hog to raise. This business helps Arthur because it’s the only source of income he has to raise his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccine, vitamins and additional hog to raise

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia, who used her previous loan to buy clothes to sell, lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a textile business dealing in wraps (bitenge), working six days a week. She gets additional income from rentals and a taxi. 

Sylivia wants a loan facility to buy bricks and cement to construct her rentals. Her dream is to educate her children to university level and to expand her rentals. She is a hardworking client; however, competition and high taxes are hardships she encounters.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to construct her rentals.

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Progreso Group

texts.es:
Yesenia y sus 4 compañeras de Banco Mujer En Progreso nos solicitan su quinto préstamo, el grupo se ha consolidado a través de los años, y las actividades que realizan son comerciales y de pequeña industria. 
Ella sigue siendo la tesorera del grupo, esto gracias a la buena gestión realizada, así lo consideran sus compañeras. De las misma manera continua trabajando en su actividad la distribución al por mayor de recipientes plásticos de cocina, y también la venta ambulante de los mismos artículos por unidad, cuenta con una cartera de clientes consolidado y cada vez más grande. Que ha logrado gracias a las inyecciones de capital de trabajo que ha recibido en cada financiamiento. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en los mismos recipientes plásticos que se vende muy bien, y le permiten generar un ingreso adicional a su núcleo familiar, con los que cubren los gastos de estudios de sus 3 hijos, siendo de gran ayuda para la familia. Yesenia sigue trabajando con mucho entusiasmo, y con nuevo planes entre ellos están realizar una mejoras a su vivienda, proyecto que esta segura que lo va a lograr gracias a las ventas de la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Yesenia and her four colleagues in Banco Mujer en Progreso are requesting their fifth loan.  The group has strengthened over the years, and their businesses are commercial and small industry.

Yesenia is still the treasurer of the bank, thanks to her good management, as her colleagues consider it.  She also still works at her job distributing plastic kitchen containers wholesale and selling the same items retail as a street vendor.  She has an established customer portfolio that grows all the time, thanks to the infusion of working capital she has received with each loan.

She'll invest this new loan in the same plastic containers.  They sell very well and allow her to earn an extra income to cover the educational expenses of her three children, a big help for her family.

Yesenia keeps on working enthusiastically.  Her new plans include making improvements to her house, a project she's sure she'll achieve thanks to sales during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen containers to distribute and sell

loans.name: Hambinintsoa

texts.fr:
Hambinintsoa est âgé de 29ans et est marié à une femme au foyer. Le couple a 1 enfant de 5ans, scolarisé. Son activité a débuté en 2011. Avant cela, il a travaillé comme maçon mais son contrat est arrivé à terme.  Il en est à son 3eme prêt et il hérite de cette activité de sa femme à cause de son état de santé défavorable. Le prêt servira à acheter : Du poisson séché, de l’huile, du savon, des bougies, du sel, des nouilles (Apollo, Presto), des couches pour bébé et cube à saveur (jumbo).
Leur maison, ainsi que leur terrain leur a était offert par son père. De plus il a déjà habité ces lieux dès son plus jeune âge. Le couple espère devenir un grossiste pour toute catégorie de produit et aussi de construire une maison, encore meilleur que la sienne en ce moment.
texts.en:
Hambinintsoa is 29 years old and married to a homemaker.  The couple has a five-year-old child who goes to school.  Hambinintsoa started his own business in 2011.  Before that, he used to work as a bricklayer but his contract came to an end.  This is his third loan.  The activity he is now involved in used to be his wife's but he took it over from her when she had to deal with some health problems.  Hambinintsoa will use his loan to buy some dried fish, some oil, soap, candles, salt, noodles (Apollo, Presto), baby diapers, and savory bouillon cubes (Jumbo).

Hambinintsoa's house, as well as the land around it, was given to him by his father.  This is where he grew up.  Hambinintsoa and his wife would like to become wholesalers one day and sell a large variety of goods.  They would also like to build another house, even nicer than the one they have at the moment.

loans.use: to buy various staple foods and dried fish.

loans.name: Ehmeedah

texts.en:
Ehmeedeh is 38 years old, is married and has five children, and lives with them and her husband in under privileged area ‎which is Rsaifeh. She is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement. She ‎struggles every day in order to get ahead with her family and to provide her children with a better future. Unfortunately, she ‎was not able to go to school due to the lack of financial resources, Ehmeedah wants to be productive woman and she ‎decided to open her business which is beauty salon to help her husband in the household supplies and to be productive ‎woman.‎
Her current goals and objectives are to provide a better future for her children and to give them better living conditions, ‎therefore she decided to apply a loan is to invest in beauty products like dyes, blush , acrylic nails, straighteners, eye ‎shadow, and nail polish, etc. to increase her incomes, and improve her standards of living.‎

loans.use: to invest in beauty products like dyes, blush , acrylic nails, straighteners, eye ‎shadow, and nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farming business

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo D. has been in business for 6 months. "I need to buy a little bit of everything. There are things that my clients ask me for that I don't have, so they go somewhere else to buy them. I would like to have a wider selection of products since the location of my business is very good for sales. If I am able to purchase all the products that I need, my sales will increase and therefore, I''l have more income. I am requesting $1,000 to invest in my office supply and gift store business."

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José Eduardo D. tiene su negocio desde hace 6 meses. "Necesito comprar un poco de todo, hay cosas que mis clientes me piden y no las tengo en existencia, así que se van a comprarlas a otra parte, me gustaría poder tener variedad en mis productos, el lugar en donde estoy ubicado es muy bueno para las ventas si logro comprar todo lo que me hace falta tendré mas venta y por lo tanto mas ingresos Solicito $1,000.00 dlls para invertir en la tienda de papelería y regalos.

loans.use:
Invest in an Office Supply and Gift store busines

Invertir en el negocio de Papeleria y Regalos

loans.name: Joska

texts.en:
Joska A. is a 35-year-old member of Life in Africa's WE Centre Gulu. Her husband died of an operation in 1996, but she does not know what sickness he was suffering from. Joska has seven children and three dependants who are orphans (from her brother who died of HIV/AIDs). Her three youngest plus those of her brother are in primary school.

Joska sells produce (rice) to get money to cover school fees and daily needs. She buys this rice from a market in Amuru District and sells it to consumers in one of the markets within Gulu Town. She also makes paper beads at Life in Africa and gets some money out of this, which has been helping her with the expenses of daily life. Her problem is paying school fees for these children she is left with.

Joska has saved 80,000= (Uganda shillings) from her business of selling rice. She is requesting a loan of 250,000= (Ush) to add on to her savings and expand her business. Her business location is in a strategic position near the prison barracks and school, so she believes she can sell more than her current capital allows. She hopes to get 40% of her capital in profit per month. She will be selling the rice herself since she does not have much work to do elsewhere and she will believes she will be able to pay back that loan within six months

Her business plan is below (amounts in Ush; = means Uganda shillings):

Transport .........................................40,000=

Buying rice........................................130,000=

Rice Hulling .......................................70,000=

Market dues...........................................4,000=

Contingency..........................................6,000=

Total..............................................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Buying Rice

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a young entrepreneur who runs a small auto repair shop out of his home and employs an assistant. He lives alone in the Rio Seco neighborhood of El Alto and currently attends auto mechanic classes to specialize his training.

He will use this loan to acquire tools (specifically a bench drill) and raw material for repair work (copper).

This is his first loan with IMPRO; the socio-economic evaluation determined that he qualifies to receive this loan to enable him to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Andres, joven emprendedor que tiene su taller de Electro Mecánico de Vehículos en su domicilio, tiene un ayudante, vive solo en zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto, actualmente esta estudiando en un instituto para especializarse mas sobre la mecánica vehicular. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para comprar herramienta (taladro de mesa) y materia prima (Cobre). Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación socio-económica califica a Andres para otorgarle el préstamo y de esa forma incentivar el crecimiento de su taller.

loans.use: To purchase tools and raw material

loans.name: Muailevai Leaana

texts.en: Muaileval Leaana is a sixty three year old lady who is married with eight children. Most of her kids are moving overseas to look for a better future, and now there are just two children living at home with her and her husband. Apart from that, she’s not relying on them for financial resources because she knows that they will eventually develop their own families as well. Muaileval Leaana would like to make ice-cakes and pancakes, not only to earn some money to live, but to use her time at home because she’s no longer able to do heavy duties; therefore, she’s applying for the amount of US $700 to buy the ingredients needed for her business, and to buy some cement, timbers, and iron roofing materials for house repairs. She's very happy with the SPBD program and hopes to stay in it for a long time.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for ice-cake store and for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad is a married man who does not have a child. He was born in 1980. This man lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village. He has been in the farming business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 45 year old married man. He lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Ali has 4 children. Ali used to be in the education sector for many years and now performs stone work. He needs a loan to buy material for his business. He will use the income he generates from his business to pay for the maintenance of his house.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Mrs. Tomasa is 57 years old, she lives in apartment 3-80 of a very poor neighborhood. Streets are not paved, there is not enough water, not many cars are seen due to the lack of paved roads. This lady's house is very humble, she lives alone, she works for a local company, and the salary she earns has been established by the local government. At this time, her house is in very bad physical conditions.

Her big dream at this time is to build a wall which will give her the support , security and stability needed. She wishes to begin construction of one of these walls until she's ready to complete it, then be able to enjoy it as she ages in time.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tomasa tiene 57 años de edad, habita en el asentamiento 3-80, un barrio pobre, con calles sin pavimentar, escasez de agua, vía poco transitadas por vehículos debido al mal estado de las calles. La vivienda de la señora es muy humilde, vive sola, trabaja como conserje en una empresa, el salario que devenga es el salario mínimo establecido por el gobierno, su casa se encuentra en malas condiciones físicas. El mayor sueño de la señora es la de construir un muro que abarque toda la vivienda para que le de soporte, seguridad y estabilidad. La señora desea iniciar a construir una a una las paredes del muro de su casa, hasta lograr terminarlo y en un fututo pueda gozar de una vejez tranquila y con mejores condiciones habitacionales.

loans.use: Purchase of materials in order to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos is 44 years old and he lives in Villa Reconciliacion, with his wife, who is a house wife, and his 4 kids who are all adults now. He sells basic items, such as rice, sugar, tins of sardines, toilet paper etc. He started this business with his own money 10 years ago, and it has helped him to pay the household costs, his kids education (they are still studying). He dreams of becoming old, together with his wife, maintaining the home financially and interacting with his community as with this business he has made good friends with many neighbours and people who live in the area. He would like credit to increase the inventory of his store, and now, as it is beach season, people are buying more food so that they can take it on holiday with them, or stay in their houses relaxing. He wants to buy fizzy drinks, tuna, bread, basic grains and tins of sardines, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Carlos es un hombre de 44 años de edad, que habita en Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa y sus 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, Se dedica al comercio de insumos básicos del hogar como arroz, azúcar, sardina enlatada, papel higiénico, etc, Este negocio lo empezó con fondos propios hace 10 años lo que le ha dado para los gastos del hogar y que sus hijos hayan estudiado y aun sigan estudiando, sueña llegar a viejo junto a su señora pudiéndose mantener económicamente de su negocio e interactuar con su comunidad ya que con este negocio también han logrado ser mas amigos de sus vecinos y demás habitantes de su barrio. Solicita un crédito para aumentar el inventario de su Pulpería, en esta época de playa la gente compra mas comida ya sea para llevar en sus paseos al mar o para su hogar los que deciden quedarse descansando, comprar gaseosas, atún, pan, granos básicos, sardina enlatada, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy beach products/Comprar productos para época de playa

loans.name: Stamil

texts.en:
Stamil is 34 years old and married, with three children. She and her husband also care for three other children.

Stamil owns a small food crops store, which she started in 2003. Every day she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She is applying for a loan to buy more food crops, such as rice, bean, peas and maize.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
Zebi is a 32 year old woman, she is married and has 3 children. Her husband repairs apartments. After finishing high school Zebi has had a business selling vegetables, including potatoes, carrots, onions and beets. She has already taken out one loan and repaid it without being late and understanding that she can properly use a loan she would like to increase her loan to 1000 somoni in order to increase her inventory. After her first loan her business grew, as did her inventory turns and profits and she is very grateful to investors and especially to KIVA for their support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зеби женщина в возросте 32 года, замужем имеет 3 детей, муж работает мастером по ремонту квартир.Шарифова Зеби после окончания средней школы занимается бизнесом по продаже овощных продуктов,картофель, морковь, лук, свекла .Шарифова Зеби уже прошла 1 степ без просрочек, поняв что смогла правильно использовать займ она хочет увеличить второй займ на 1000 сомони для увеличения товара.После первого займа у нее увеличился бизнес, оборот и прибыль.она очень благодарна инвестора , а особенно KIVA за их поддержку.

loans.use: Purchase Vegetables

loans.name: Naza

texts.en: Naza is 28 years old and living near the town of Gračanica.  She lives here with her husband and 2 children, ages 3 and 9.   Her husband has a full time job, which is the family’s primary source of income.  This is her first loan.  She would like to use part of this loan to buy food for her animals, and hopefully also spend some of the funding on a project to renovate their barn.  She hopes to eventually buy more cows and expand her farming business, and this loan will be the first step in the process.

loans.use: To buy food for animals.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda B. sells groceries and owns the grocery store. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Matilda and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Matilda is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 39 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two sons; Guido, who is 20, and Joel, who is 12, both of whom attend school. To help support her family, Ana has worked for 20 years selling shoes around the city of Juliaca. Her business has grown thanks to the various styles of shoes she offers to her customers. She travels to other cities such as Ayaviri, Puno to sell her shoes, and also works in local city markets.

Ana likes her work, but the constant travel makes things difficult for her. She would like to set up small stands in the main markets she visits, and so she is requesting a loan to purchase inventory and continue to grow her business.

Ana tiene 39 años, es separada y vive con sus dos hijos, Guido D. 20 años y Joel D. 12, quienes son estudiantes. Ella se dedica, desD. hace 20 años, a la venta D. calzado, para poder mantener a su familia, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria al por mayor y menor en la ciudad D. Juliaca, los novedosos y variados diseños hacen que el negocio D. Ana esté creciendo y obtenga más clientela D. la que ya tiene. Ella viaja a ofrecer su mercadería a las ciudades D. Ayaviri, Puno y venD. en las ferias dominicales D. la ciudad, le gusta su trabajo, pero el tener que viajar tanto con su mercadería, la cual es un poco pesada se le hace difícil. Ana quiere tener un puesto en cada uno D. los diferentes mercados D. las ciudades que ella visita, es así que con el dinero que ella solicita piensa comprar mucha más mercadería y poder incrementar su capital y su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INVENTORY TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS SELLING SHOES.   AS A SINGLE MOTHER, ANA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR EDUCATING AND TAKING CARE OF HER TWO SONS ON HER OWN.

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
La señora Orfith, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”  vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de pollos eviscerados. El negocio se ubica en el mercado de la localidad, lugar donde tiene un puesto de venta y donde acuden a diario a comprar gran cantidad de clientes. También reparte a las señoras que venden comida y bodegas de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/. 2,200, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará pollos en grandes cantidades para luego sacrificarlos y poder proveer a sus clientes de la ciudad, además comprará ganados para criarlos y venderos cuando sea necesario.

Orfith es una mujer entusiasta de 28 años de edad. Se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos, pues tiene asegurada su venta. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio y poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orfith, member of the “Judith Tuanama” Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martín, El Dorado province, district of San José de Sisa. She makes a living selling chickens whose entrails have already been removed. Her business is situated in the local market, where she has a regular stand and where large quantities of clients frequent daily. She also sells to neighborhood women who sell food and to grocery stores around the city. With this loan of S/.2,200, which she will repay in six installments, she hopes to buy large quantities of chickens to slaughter as necessary to provide for her clients. She also hopes to buy livestock, which she will raise and sell when necessary. Mrs. Orfith is an enthusiastic woman of 28 years of age. She is happy to be given the possibility of reaching her proposed objectives. Her ultimate goal is to further expand her business and to see her children enter a profession.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchasing of chicken.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Bokk Diom Group

texts.fr:
Thiaroye sur mer est une commune où sévit encore la pauvreté. La population est très volontaire et lutte par tous ses moyens pour sortir de cette situation peut enviable dû à l’inflation et au sous emploi. C’est dans ce contexte que le groupement Bokk Diom s'est levé pour prendre en charge son sort et travailler pour l’amélioration durement. L’opportunité que nous offre  Kiva est à ne pas rater car répondant parfaitement avec ce que nous cherchons, le groupement Bokk Diom compte saisir cette opportunité et travailler de façon saine. L’objectif de  ce prêt s’inscrit dans le désir des membres de lutter de façon résolu contre la pauvreté dans la localité et de promouvoir ses membres au plan socio économique. 
Bokk  Diom compte faire du commerce divers allant du commerce de tissus aux produits céréaliers aux légumes, aux poissons frais, aux fruits, aux détergeants et la couture.
Chaque membre développe une activité qu’elle compte améliorer et renforcer.
texts.en:
Thiaroye-sur-Mer is a city where poverty still rages. The population there is very voluntary and fight with every available means to get out of this unenviable situation caused by inflation and underemployment. It is in this context that the Bokk Diom group formed itself, aiming at working to durably improve things. The opportunity that's being offered by Kiva should not be missed, because it corresponds perfectly to what the group is seeking. The Bokk Diom group intends to take this opportunity and work soundly. The aim of this loan comes within the scope of the group members' desire to resolutely fight poverty within the city, and to promote their social and economic status. Bokk Diom intends to run various businesses, selling products ranging from fabrics to cereals and vegetables, fresh fish, fruits, detergents, and sewing. Each member has her own business that she plans to bolster and strengthen.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fabrics, cereals, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es socia D. Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Josefina es casada, tiene 67 años y 7 hijos entre D. 56 y 32 años. 
Josefina tiene un negocio desD. hace 20 años, ella venD. todo lo que es lencería, Josefina tiene el puesto numero 7 en el mercado Virgen D. Lourdes, venD. todos los días.     
Josefina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lencería , también en la compra D. polos.  
Josefina sueña con  surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of Mar del Plata Communal Bank. Josefina is 67 and married, with 7 children from 32 to 56 years old. She has had a business for 20 years selling all sorts of lingerie. She has stall no. 7 in the Virgen D. Lourdes market, selling every day. Josefina needs a loan of $200 to purchase lingerie as well as polo shirts. She dreams of increasing the stock for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lingerie and polo shirts

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La señora Jovita tiene 67 años D. edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Manuel Seoane y vive en la calle Alexander Pettion 1155 del distrito La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer grado D. primaria, pero no siguió estudiando porque murió su madre. Se casó D. 15 años y tiene 7 hijos casados.
Su negocio consiste en la venta D. pollo. Ella lo despresa en su casa y lo venD. por pedidos y también en el Mercado La Hermelinda.
Con este crédito D. S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará pollo y también piensa guardar para comprar pollo para la Navidad, ya que es una fiesta donD. se venD. mucha carne D. ave.
Jovita sueña con ser mayorista en la venta D. pollo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jovita is 67 years old and belongs to the Solidario Manuel Seoane group; she lives on Alexander Pettion Street in La Esperanza in the city of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. She studied through 3rd graD. of elementary school but could not continue because her mother passed away. She married at the age of 15 and she has 7 married children. She works selling chicken. She cuts the chicken in pieces in her home and sells it in the Hermelinda Market. With this $100 loan which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy chicken and save some to sell during Christmas since it is traditionally a festival where people eat a lot of poultry. Jovita dreams of being a chicken wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La señora Celinda, socia del BC “Los Jazmines”,  vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito D. Moyobamba. Tiene 61 años D. edad, es madre D. 06 hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Se dedica a la venta D. menestras sancochadas y quesos en su puesto en el mercado central D. la ciudad.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será  pagado en  6 meses, comprará diferentes variedades D. frijoles como huasca, canario, pinto entre otros para sancocharlos y venderlos al menudeo, también comprará leche en grandes cantidades para la preparación D. quesos y satisfacer los gustos D. sus clientes.  

Celinda es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer en su negocio, además más adelante desea surtir mas su negocio con más variedad D. productos a ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Celinda, a member of the "Los Jazmines" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyobamba. She is 61 years old and the mother of 6 children, who are all adults. She sells stews and cheeses from her stand in the city's central market. With this loan for S/. 1,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy different varieties of dried beans such as canary beans and pinto beans, to cook and sell. She will also buy large quantities of milk to prepare cheeses and satisfy the different tastes of her customers. Celinda is a very hard-working women who wants to see her business grow. In the future she would like to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different varieties of dried beans.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El Sr. Vicente S. se dedica a la venta de productos basicos como ser arroz, azucar, manteca, papel higienico y abarroterria en general, su negocio se encuentra bien ubicado en el centro comercial de la Septima Avenida (comayaguela) se vende productos al por menor y mayor, cuenta con clientes fijos los que llegan a su negocioy los que transitan por el lugar, cuenta con dos años de experiencia, el Sr. necesita un credito para poder comprar mas productos y asi tener mayores ingresos, el negocio es atendido por su esposa la Sra. Orbelinda la cual es muy conocida en el centro comercial por su amabilidad con los clientes y esto le permite estar al cuidado de sus dos hijos, el Sr. tambien recibe otros ingresos ya que tiene otro trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente S. has been selling basic products like rice, sugar, butter, toilet paper at his general store. His business has been doing well in the mall of Septima Avenida (Comayaguela). For the past two years, he has sold products of all shapes and sizes to customers who pass by his shop along the way.

Mr. S. needs a loan to be able to purchase more products to earn more profits. His wife, Mrs. Orbelinda attends to the business too and is well known for her kindess to all who she encounters in the mall. All this allows her to effectively care for her two children; at the same time, Mrs. Orbelinda also receives other forms of income from her other jobs as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various small goods for cooking

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 55 años, vive con una de sus hijas mayores. Hace unos meses instaló una tiene en su misma casa, donde atiende todos los días incluyendo los fines de semana y durante casi todo el día ofreciendo productos de primera necesidad a sus vecinos que son sus principales consumidores. Aurora atiende con mucha calidez a sus clientes lo cual dio como resultado la creciente demanda en el consumo de los productos que vende en su bodega que son verduras, víveres,  dulces, bebidas entre otras, para ello Aurora se abastece casi todos los días de la mercadería necesaria  y sus proveedores acuden hasta su tienda para ofrecerles esa mercadería que necesita y lo mas conveniente para ella son las ofertas y promociones que le ofrecen al vender un nuevo producto. Ahora no solo desea seguir vendiendo productos de primera necesidad sino que además implementará para los próximos meses la venta de artículos de regalo, detalles y útiles de escritorio. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella  fue invitada para ser una integrante más que apoye el buen desarrollo de su banco comunal. La cantidad que está solicitando es para la compra de nueva mercadería de gaseosas y útiles de escritorio.
texts.en:
Aurora is 55; she lives with one of her older daughters. Some months ago, she installed a shop in her house, which is open practically all day, seven days a week. She sells staple items to her neighbors, who are her main customers.

Because Aurora provides a very good service to her customers, demand has grown for the merchandise she sells, including vegetables, groceries, candy and drinks. She receives deliveries of merchandise practically every day. The promotions that suppliers offer to sell a new product are particularly beneficial to her.

Now she wants not only to continue selling staple items but to expand in the next few months to sell gifts items, stationery and writing supplies. This her first loan application to MFP; she was invited to join the community bank and support its development. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks and writing materials for sale.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
K. Rasul is dedicated to farming activities and has been engaged in this activity for 20 years. Presently he is the father of two children. He must continue providing them with the conditions necessary for their scholastic development. His reason for coming to IMON International is to obtain a loan with which he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops. Rasul and his family will benefit a lot from this loan, and so he is waiting for his request to be granted, and in this way he will have the financial capital to continue with his business in agriculture.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Poy C. is 37 years old and she lives in Roka village, in Takeo province. She is a rice soup seller. Her husband, Phen Uy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a palm juice collector.

Although they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to provide a better house for their family. In order to solve this problem, Poy decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a house.

She has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Add her savings to buy timber to build the house.

loans.name: Janeth Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Janeth Pérez desde hace 14 años inició su negocio de ferretería ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua donde a diario atiende muy amablemente ofreciendo todo tipo de productos ferreteros en su localidad.

Actualmente a ella se le han agotado algunos productos y requiere comprarlos. Entre estos productos se encuentran candados, tubos pvc y accesorios para el hogar. Es por esto que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros y así continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Mrs. Janeth Pérez started her hardware business 14 years ago in Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo, which she tends daily, kindly offering all types of hardware products in her shop. Currently, she’s run out of certain products and needs to purchase more. Some of the items needed are locks, PVC pipes and accessories for the home. This is why she is asking for Ceprodel’s help to get a loan, so she can purchase more hardware products and continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware products and home accessories

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Soutoura est  constitué de sept femmes  mariées dont trois polygames et quatre monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent à Sanoubougou I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur  cinquième   collaboration avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin de la  clientèle et augmenter leur profit. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de pagnes,  de condiments alimentaires,  des fruits et  des céréales.
Elles comptent acheter,  30 pièces de pagnes, 20 paniers de condiments, 30 colis de fruits et 20 sacs de100 kg de céréales. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et en détail.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Soutoura ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group is composed of seven married women (three polygamous and four monogamous), who average 38 years of age and 4 children. They live in Sanoubougou I, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They are seeking their fifth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better meet customer demand and increase their profits. All previous loans were repaid without problems.

They run various businesses, among others : selling pagnes (colorful African cloth), food condiments, fruits, and cereals. They intend to buy 30 pieces of pagnes, 20 baskets of condiments, 30 boxes of fruits, and 20 100-kg sacks of cereals. They get their supplies at the grand market in Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. They retail their goods for cash at the grand market in Sikasso, at home, and as traveling saleswomen, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

They foresee turning a monthly profit of XOF 19'000 (ca US$ 40) each, to be used in part to help their husbands. The remainder will be used to repay the loan and to invest into their businesses. The women of the Soutoura group ambition to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various items, such as pagnes (colorful African cloth), condiments, fruits, and cereals

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a resident of Purok (district) Namnama Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 43 years old and is married to a farmer named Victor Rossel. They are blessed with three children; Marjorie, the eldest, is 20 years old and presently studying in college, Jenny Rose is 18 years old and is also studying in college, finally Victor M. Jr., is 16 years old and will graduate from high school next year. As a mother who dreams for all of her children to finish their studies, she will do everything to provide for their needs. Their studies are her priority, and she is willing to sacrifice to reach their goals in life, for she believes their goals are also her goals and that their success someday will also be her success.

Marites cooks snacks like “pansit” out of her snack house in her village. Sometimes, she also sells house to house and fortunately she is generating enough income to sustain their daily needs. She is again hoping for a loan of PHP 5,000. This little amount will provide the capital she needs in her business. Marites hopes that she will manage to continuously support the financial needs of her two children who are studying in college. Their tuition fees are very high and she is really working hard just to pay their tuition fees in school and provide them their daily allowances. By patience, Marites believe, she will overcome the hardship of life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Impacto Group

texts.es: El banco comunal denominado “Impacto” esta representado por  la señora Mariela, conformado por 13 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican al servicio de secretariado, pero alguna de las socias se dedican a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ropa, pan al transporte publico y a la confección de prendas de vestir. La competencia en la venta de productos es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de crecer ya que de ello depende el bien estar de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la apertura de negocios independientes y para la adquisición de mercarías para incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida de vida. A pesar que los integrantes del grupo no tienen experiencia en grupos solidaR. tienen las ganas de trabajar para salir adelante y dan gracias por poder contar con el apoyo económico que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Impacto (Impact) Communal Bank is represented by Señora Mariela and is composed of 13 members, the majority of whom are engaged in secretarial work. However, some of the members work at cosmetics catalog sales or selling clothing, or bread to public transport passengers, or they work at manufacturing articles of clothing. Their competence at selling products is high but the members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to grow since the well being of their families depends on it. The objective of the loan is to open up independent businesses and for the acquisition of merchandise in order to increase their incomes and be able to provide their families with a better quality of life. Despite the fact that the group members don't have experience in solidarity groups they are eager to work to get ahead, and they are thankful for being able to have the economic support that Fundación Agrocapital provides them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Pelagia viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales, productos que vende en la ciudad de Cañete a donde viaja cada 15 días, además Pelagia vende papa en el mercado de Covadonga.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y papa.
Los sueños de Pelagia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the Power Community Bank. She is married, is 39 years old, and has 5 children. Pelagia travels to fairs, where she buys cereals, which she sells in the city of Cañete, where she travels every 15 days. Also, Pelagia sells potatoes in the market of Covadonga. Pelagia needs a loan of 1050 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of cereals and potatoes. Pelagia’s dreams are for her children become professionals and to have her own stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals and potatoes

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Heriberto Antonio A., tiene la edad de 56 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua,  casado, su esposa tiene una pulpería y sus hijos son mayores de edad. Don Heriberto trabaja en una empresa privada ene. Área de Mantenimiento en una constructora desde hace cinco años. Su objetivo  es tener una buena pensión que le permita sastifcer sus necesidades, con este préstamo que esta haciendo es su once avo ciclo el cual ocupara para comprar materiales de construcción y hacer un aumento a un cuarto. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo y los beneficios alcanzados para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Heriberto Antonio A. is 56 years old, married, and the father of adult children. He resides in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. His wife operates her own grocery store. Don Heriberto has been working in the maintenance department of a private construction company for 5 years. His goal is to earn a good pension that will pay for basic necessities.

Don Heriberto is currently on his 11th loan cycle. He will buy building materials to expand a room in his house. He thanks the institution for the support and benefits provided to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to expand a room

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mr. C. Chhum has been driving a motor taxi for three months. Mrs. Sopheak Cheav has been selling mangoes for six years. C. is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to help finance his wife's purchase of mangoes on contract. The loan will also be used to buy pesticides to protect the mangoes from insects.

Mr. C. Chhum, age 36, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheak Cheav, age 34, live along National Road Number One, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1995 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two children attend school and the other one is still too young. The couple hopes to support their children's further education.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract for resale

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El señor Fidencio V. tiene ya más de 15 años a  su negocio de papelería y abarrotes, esté negocio y su empleo como maestro de físico – química es el ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo.
 Desea invertir mas en la papelería con el regreso a clases tiene muy buenas ventas y con eso nuevo ingreso pagara el préstamo.

loans.use: Comprar mecánica para el negocio

loans.name: Jamirah's Group

texts.en:
N. Jamirah is 28 years old and a single mother of four children between the ages of 3 and 12. She also takes care of her young sister, Najjuko Faridah. Jamirah sells roasted plantains (gonja) at the Namawojjolo market. She has been in business for 15 years, selling to customers in vehicles on the Jinja road highway. One challenge she has here, is that customers at times go with the gonja without paying for them, reducing her profit. She is able to make a profit of 100,000/= a week, and she still hopes for better.

Jamirah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She has a dream of owning a retail shop in Namawojjolo, where she hopes to make more profits due to her good customer service. After that, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house for her children. She needs a loan to help expand her business by buying gonjas in bulk which reduces the cost of purchase.

loans.use: To buying 'gonjas' for roasting

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie A. is from the village of Luyong in the western district of Bonbon, Opol Municipality in the province of Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. Menchie owns a retail store where she sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Menchie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Menchie joined HSPFI to gain access to their financial services. Menchie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to expand her stock. Menchie is requesting a second loan of 8000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to expand her shop's products

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey S., 36, is married with 5 children. She lives with her husband her elderly mother (pictured) in Battambong Province. She is engaged in the businesses of selling vegetables and sewing clothes in a local market, earning an income of approximately US $3 per day. Her husband operates his motor taxi and provides his transportation services to people in the town and markets, earning an income of US $4 per day as a primary source of income for the family. S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike to transport more vegetables to sell at the market. Also, the motorbike will be useful for them to transport their children to school and thus cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita D. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Emelita is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a variety store.Her  main source of income for the business comes from selling foods and daily-used products in the local community. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Emelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Emelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy N., age 37, is married to Hong Hol, 39, and they are villagers living in Siem Reap Province. They own a larger size farm where they plant green beans to earn a living. In addition, this couple have always bought the nearby neighbor’s beans to resell and gain additional income. The family lives with two teenage children, who attend the local high school. Suy N. would like to use the kiva loan as capital in order to purchase green bean from other growers and resell them to raise income.

loans.use: To collect green bean from other growers and resell them to raise income

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina G. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Marina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing dress-making services to local community members. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & thread. Marina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim S. is a married woman who is 38 years old. She has been a farmer, a skill she learned from her grandmother, for years. She plants rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. Her husband is a local palm climber who taps palm juice and turns it into palm sugar for selling. 

This couple was married many years ago and has three teenage children. Their children attend school and also help them on the farm when they are free from their classes. 

Chhim S. needs a loan to buy a small piece of her neighbor’s farmland, where she will also grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a small piece of neighbor’s farmland to grow crops on

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is 28 years old, married, and has three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Maame earns income selling potatoes, kenkey, and other foodstuffs. She buys her goods from nearby towns and sells them to food vendors in her community and by the roadside. Maame has been in this business for 8 years and currently needs a loan to procure additional foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sr. Mercedes M. T. se dedica a  la elaboración de ladrillos de barro para construcción de estructuras como casa de habitación, etc. El solicita un crédito en Ceprodel el cual será utilizado para la compra de un zinc.

El Sr. Mercedes M. T. empezó a dedicarse a esta labor desde hace 6 años y hasta entonces ha seguido con la elaboración de este producto el cual es de muy buena demanda en estas zonas, el trabaja desde las 7 am hasta las 12 del medio día ya que es el tiempo estimado que el dilata en producir un estimado de producción diaria que a el le piden. Este cliente antes de dedicarse a esta labor trabajaba en la agricultura.

El Sr. Mercedes M. T.   espera mejorar las condiciones físicas de su casa con la compra del zinc una vez otorgado el crédito, ya que su techo esta bastante deteriorado.

El Sr. Mercedes M. T.   es casado y tiene 2 hijas una de ellas en edad escolar a la que le costea los estudios.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que el Sr. Mercedes M. T.  tiene con Ceprodel en un periodo de 5 años. Mercedes M. T.  expresa que con los financiamientos de Ceprodel el a podido llevar a cabo varios proyectos familiares que de manera propia no los habría podido logra como es la compra del zinc para la reparación del techo ya que les brindara mejor seguridad a el y su familia antes los cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. T. has a business making clay bricks for the construction of structures such as houses, etc. He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL that will be used to purchase corrugated metal sheeting. Mr. T. began this line of work 6 years ago, and since then he has continued to make this product, which is in high demand in these areas. He works from 7am until noon, since this is the estimated time that it takes to make up the daily orders. Prior to this, he worked in agriculture. Mr. T. hopes to improve the physical condition of his house with the purchase of corrugated metal roofing materials, since the roof of his house is quite deteriorated. Mr. T. is married and has 2 daughters, one whom is school-aged, and he must pay for her studies. This is the 4th loan that Mr. T. has taken with CEPRODEL over a period of 5 years. He says that with the financings from CEPRODEL he has been able to bring about various family projects on his own that he never would have been able to manage, like the purchase of metal roofing materials for the repair of his roof, which will provide better security for his family before the rainy season comes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (corrugated metal roofing material)

loans.name: Nidia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  señora Nidia M. labora como secretaria en uno de los mercados de Managua.
 
Ella  tiene  un hijo a su cargo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar y ella busca la manera de cómo brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que así se requiere. Ella comprará  5 láminas de zinc y otros materiales para llevar a cabo esta obra y así beneficiar a su hijo que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Nidia M. M. works as a secretary for the administrators of the Israel Lewites Market in Managua. She has one child that is of school age and is looking to provide the best conditions necessary for his development. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to invest in construction materials, such as 5 sheets of zinc for her home's kitchen, which is currently in poor condition. Nidia reports that thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to improve the home in which she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and expanding her home

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar has been working as a farmer for the past 12 years. He is a married man, 51 years old, and has three children. He owns land and cultivates it with a variety of fruits and vegetables according to the season. His children help in the household and they cooperate as a family to better their living conditions. 

Today, Omar is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for the summer cultivation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
K. Sarin, 35, is married with three children and lives in Takeo province. She is a farmer, making around US$2 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman who is able to generate US$2 each day as well.

K. Sarin is asking for a loan of US$550 to raise chickens, pigs and cows. She needs the money to purchase the animals and also the feed. Along with her ability to generate income through the purchase of animals, she would like to purchase a water pump.

K. Sarin believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: To raise cows, pigs and chickens and to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B., 58, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Fernando B., a retiree, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for the last eighteen years.

Isabel has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow sixteen times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Isabel would like to obtain a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries and other supplies needed to replenish her current product inventory.

Isabel dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she is able to show her children, through her example, how to be self-reliant and independent.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other supplies needed to replenish her inventory

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Esta cliente se dedica a la venta de comida, fresco gaseosa dulces como arroz en leche, atolillos cajetas en su casa de habitación, tiene diez años de experiencia en el negocio y el crédito lo necesita para poder cubrir un encargo de treinta servicios de comida extra  que le esta contratando una institución para su personal por lo tanto tiene que invertir para poder cumplir con el pedido y poder dar respuesta a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This client sells food, soft drinks, sweets like “arroz en leche” (rice in milk), hot drinks, and caramels in her house. She has ten years of experience in the business. She needs the loan to be able to cover the cost of an order to provide service for 30 extra meals. An institution wants to contract her to provide this service. She needs to make purchases to be able to fill the order and give an answer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her eatery

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 53 years old. Francisco is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a business operating a motor transport service. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Francisco from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Âgée de 46 ans, Sali B. est une femme mariée et mère de six  enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).                       
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est vite initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité de petit commerce d’achat-vente de pagnes wax , de tissus brodés,  de bazins teintés, etc. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.  
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de cinq  ans. Elle a bénéficié  de plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier et  est actuellement à son onzième individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes Wax, 6 complets de tissus brodés, 5 complets de bazin “moins riche” en couleur à Bamako.                                                                                                         Elle dispose d’une place au niveau de marché de leur quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Elle amène souvent ses marchandises dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso les jours de leur foires pour être vendues.                                                                                                            Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
46 years of age, Sali Mamba is married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and children in Mamassoni, an outer district of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Not having had an opportunity to attend school for social reasons, about ten years ago she quickly launched a small business buying and reselling wax “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing], embroidered fabrics, dyed “bazins” [a type of damask cloth highly prized in West Africa], etc. Her business is very popular with her customers (mostly women) due to high quality of her goods. In order to better meet the demands of her growing customer base, five years ago she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She had benefitted from several “solidarity” loans (group loans) in the past, and is now on her 11th individual loan, which will allow her to purchases 15 sets of wax “pagnes,” six sets of embroidered cloth, and five sets of dyed “bazins” of mid-range quality in Bamako. She has a vendor spot at the local market, where she sells her goods in cash or on credit to a customer base composed essentially of women. She often brings her goods to other areas around Sikasso in order to sell them on local market days. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 190,000 West African francs, which will be mainly used to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for traditional apparel

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine G. lives in Ijevan city. She is married and has two children. Marine works at Ijevan city administration, and at the same time she runs her own bakery, which is on the ground floor of her house. With the profits from her business, Marine takes care of her family and pays for her daughters’ education. Marine delivers her production to 12 nearby food shops, and now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow her to deliver her production to distant food shops as well. Marine has borrowed loans from Nor Horizon 3 times, and she has never been delayed with her repayments.

loans.use: To buy a car to deliver her production to distant food shops.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Yolanda is married and has four adult-aged children.
