Within the commercial sector, there is always competition, but to be able to compete, only aptituD. and good products are needed. The loan will be used to purchase products and materials to improve the group’s work tools and to strengthen the presentation of their services. The bank members do not have communal bank experience, but are hard-working and honest. For that reason, Agrocapital Foundation is giving them the opportunity to manage their loans and increase their income. That way, their quality of life and that of their families will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: José Cruz

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Cruz G. le está haciendo falta un cuarto para sus hijos, ya  que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio. 
  Don José Cruz está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material ya que el y un hijo  se dedican  a la construcción de casa y en horas adicionales a su trabajo, realizara la mejora que desea y así sus niños tendrán su recamara para que estén cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
The home of Mr. José Cruz G. is missing a room for his children now that they are growing and need their own space. Mr. José Cruz is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials given that he and one of his sons are carrying out construction on the house during hours outside of work. He will accomplish the home improvements that he hopes for and this way his children will have a bedroom so that they can be comfortable and happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Nergiy

texts.en: G. Nergui lives with her husband and two children in Tsetserleg city in Arkhangai province. The children are 11th grade students. Her husband runs a small carpenter business. In 2001, G. started selling raw meat in the local market. In 2003, she took her first loan from the bank. Since then, she has taken 15 loans from XacBank, Kiva's partner in Mongolia, and the result has been very good. She always pays back her loans on time. Since the bank loans began, she has significantly improved her family's standard of living. She is self-confident and good at attracting customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and to have her own place. She would also like to branch out into surrounding small towns. G. started her business with 200,000 tugrig ($1 USD=1,570 tugrug) and it has now increased to 2,000,000-2,500,000 tugrig. Since the start, she managed to buy a small car and work equipment, and she built a small working space next to her home.  G. is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more meat for her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her business

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Lonh C. is a villager living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, where she earns a living selling Khmer noodles. Since she started this business, she has gained more income because she cooks tasty food, sells at a better price, and  communicates well with her fellow villagers. She lives with her child and her husband, who sells fish at the market. Because Mrs. C.'s house is too small, she has decided to ask for a $500 loan that, added to her savings, will allow her to build a new stone house.

loans.use: To build a new stone house

loans.name: Jose Paz

texts.es:
La esposa del señor José Paz aparece en la fotografía ya que el trabaja doble turno en la escuela mañana y tarde. El trabaja como maestro por más de ocho años y su esposa siempre se ha dedicado al cuidado de sus hijos como al hogar.
El profesor piensa en el patrimonio y comodidad de la familia por lo que con el tiempo primero construyó una barda y piso firme en la parte de atrás de su casa, ahora ve la oportunidad de poner losa y así hacer un cuarto más para ampliarse por que su familia es grande es padre de 3 hijos que necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
The wife of Mr. José Paz appears in the picture because he works double shifts at the school morning and afternoon. He has worked as a teacher for over eight years and his wife has always been dedicated to caring for their children and home. The teacher thinks of the well-being and comfort of his family and started out building a strong wall and floor in the back of his house. He now sees an opportunity to add a stone floor and another room to expand his house for his large family, since he is the father of 3 children who need their own space.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install stone floor and expand house

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa S. is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says one of her children is in the university. The others are in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to assist her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

Theresa is a businesswoman. She runs a provisions store on one of the principal streets in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children a sound education.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
Cinderella O. has been a businesswoman for almost three years. She is currently residing in Zone 10, Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City in Northern Mindanao, Philippines. She owns a variety store in their village where she sells all the basic needs of her customers. She earns PHP 500.00 in a day and manages to purchase additional items for her variety store twice a week. Aside from that, Cinderella is engaged in the hog-fattening business. She raises piglets and sells them in the market. They are worth PHP 1200.00 each.

Cinderella is working hard for the future of her child. She wants to help manage her family with her husband. At the present time, her husband is working in Montaña Subdivision as a contractual mason or locally known as "panday". Cinderella assesses that this is not enough to feed their needs, especially that they now have their child. This is the reason why Cinderella wants to expand her business. In connection with that, she is now applying for a loan to HSPFI-KIVA partner. She is looking forward to the possible action regarding her request.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Variety Store

location.town: Zone 10, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Víctor Andrés Belaunde Nº 489, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 40 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a su único hijo, y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que antes vendía zapatos y en su trayectoria paso por muchas dificultades, pero su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante sola le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes, y por la buena sazón de sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lili belongs to the "Las Estrellitas II" Community Bank and lives at 489 Victor Andres Belaunde Street, in Tarapoto District, San Martin Province and Department. She is separated, 40 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her. Wanting to see her only son become a professional and to earn her own income to be able to achieve that goal, she decided to start her own business. She tells us that she used to sell shoes and that she went through a lot of difficulties, but her strong will and desire to get ahead have helped to start her own business selling prepared foods. She continues with that business now and it is going very well. She has steady customers and is well known for her clientele and for the tastiness of her food. With this loan of 1800 PEN she wants to invest in materials for her dishes, such as sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs, bananas, pastas and oils, as well as cooking utensils, in order to be able to offer quality service. She feels great strength to continue selling food and eventually grow her business into a well-appointed restaurant, to provide better service to her clientele. She is grateful to the Manuala Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for catering business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria López C. , tiene la edad de 52 años , habita en el barrio San Caralampio , ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a sus hijos , ella es madre soltera , tiene cinco hijos tres ya casados e independiente , los dos estudian y le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , desde hace 16 años doña Maria se dedica a la agricultura , ella inicio esta actividad ya que fue apoyada por la reforma agraria , los planes hacia su finca es mejorar y diversificar el cultivo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos el cual aplicara al cultivo y lograr una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de crédito y los plazos que le ha dado ya que ha mejorado su cultivo, y en lo personal ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria López C. is 52 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood in the town of Concepción. She is a single mother of five sons – three are married and live on their own, and the other two are students who help with the farm work. Mrs. Maria has been farming for 16 years, which she started as a result of land reform. Her plans include diversifying her crops and improving her harvest yields.

With this loan, she will purchase fertilizers and other farming supplies needed to ensure a harvest that brings in good prices at market. She thanks AFODENIC for giving her the opportunity to receive a loan, which has allowed her to make improvements around her farm and in her overall living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Providing an additional loan for a home

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn B., age 35, is married and has 2 children who are not yet old enough to have been enrolled in a school. He lives with his wife in Phnom Penh City. He and his wife work together in a sewing business at home to make a living. This earns them collectively an income of US $5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, B. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, B. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more various kinds of fabrics to use to design good clothes to sell.

loans.use: fabric purchase

loans.name: Ayobola

texts.en: Ayobola is 37 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. She sells sarongs. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell so that she meets the demand from the increasing number of her customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a member of the Miembeni borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 21 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 1 year old.

Saumu has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Saumu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Saumu hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is a father of three who owns a small shop in a residential area of Kisumu. Arthur has been in this business for the past nine years, selling sodas, sugar, cooking oil, rice, eggs, and other staples. Previously, Arthur worked a variety of small jobs that enabled him to save enough money to start his business. Although Arthur faces several business challenges, including price fluctuations and security, he has already successfully repaid six loans to SMEP. He has just requested a new loan of KES 70,000 in order to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his shop.  Arthur describes himself as friendly, humble, practical, and faithful.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Luk

texts.en: Luk N., 41, is married and lives with two of her children in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. They also often purchase a stock of rice to resell to wholesalers at the market for an additional profit to raise their standard of living. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. Luk N. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase rice in bulk to get a special discount. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: Buy and sell rice.

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita T. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Pelita is single and has 3 infants. To make a living, Pelita runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling "suka" (Filipino vinegar) in the community. Pelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pelita joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pelita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Pelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita C. is from the village of Locsoon in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Estrellita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Estrellita raises and sells pigs. Estrellita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Estrellita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase piglets that she raised and then sold. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Estrellita's 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom O. lives in Pravong village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she earns a living by growing rice. She also runs a small business on the side making shoes. Because this business is doing well, she would like to expand it, and has applied for a loan to buy more of the materials she uses to make shoes. Her husband, Mr. Kun Kong, helps her run her business. The couple have three children, two of whom are in school, while the third is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to expand a small shoe-making business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom S., 60, is a widow who lives with three of her children in Siem Reap province. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises pigs. On average, she makes about US$2.50 of profit every day. She is also aided by three of her children who are construction workers building houses.

Mom S. is requesting a loan of US$800 to support her children’s needs to buy construction tools. Mom S. was not available for the photo so one of her sons is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy construction tools for her sons

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
A. Rustam is 48 years old. He is married with nine children. For more than 10 years, Rustam has been running a joiner’s shop, manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. His elder son (pictured) is also involved in this business. The current business is quite profitable and generates a stable income, allowing Rustam to support his family and improve their living conditions. Rustam is respected as a good master in his neighborhood. Now he needs to purchase input materials for his manufacturing shop. For this purpose, he requests 6,000 Somoni. Rustam promises to repay his loan on time and thanks everyone for their support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase input materials for his manufacturing needs.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Buena Vista es residente en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por tres miembros que siempre han trabajado juntos, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Carlos Antonio N. tiene 29 años de edad y vive con sus padres, se dedica a la compra y  venta de agua en coche y leña que el acarrea en su propia carreta de dos ruedas y un caballo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. Carlos esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar mas leña. la leña en esta comunidad es muy utilizada casi por todos los pobladores ya que la mayoria de las personas utilizan fogones para cocinar. Carlos sale a vender la leña a diferentes localidades y caserios retirados y en los cuales no muchas personas venden este tipo de producto.
 
Vicenta I. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en union libre, no tiene dependientes, todos sus hijos estan casados, Vicenta se dedica a la compra y venta de leña, esta la vende con sus vecinos y amigos
este negocio lo realiza desde hace 08 años esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leña, necesita comprar 8 carretadas de leña ya que despues se pone mas cara y casi no tiene ganancias.
 
Gustavo Eduardo R. tiene 25 años de edad es soltero se dedica a la venta de leña, ademas trabaja de turnos por la noche en una empacadora de camaron, es muy trabajador, vive con sus padres. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace unos 6 años esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leña.

La Leña en este lugar se vende muy bien, es, por no decir la unica fuente de calor para la mayoria de los fogones de todos los hogares de esta comunidad.
texts.en:
The Buena Vista Solidarity Group is located in the city of San Lorenzo and is made up of three members who have always worked together. Here are some details about the different activities they are involved in: Mr. Carlos Antonio N. is 29 years old and lives with his parents. He buys and sells water and firewood that he hauls in his own two-wheeled cart and horse. He has done this for the past 10 years. Carlos is soliciting the loan in order to buy more firewood. The firewood in this community is used by almost all the inhabitants as the majority of people cook over a fire. Carlos goes out to sell firewood in different locations and in isolated villages where not many people sell this type of product. Vicenta I. is 60 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has no dependants as all her children are married. Vicenta buys and sells firewood to her neighbors and friends. She has done this for the past 8 years. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy more firewood. She needs to buy 8 cartloads of firewood now as the price will soon increase which makes it hard to make a profit. Gustavo Eduardo R. is 25 years old and single. He sells firewood. He also works nightshift at a shrimp packing plant. He is very hard working. He lives with his parents. He has had this business for the past 6 years and is seeking a loan in order to buy more firewood. The firewood in this area sells very well as the fireplace is the only source of heating in the majority of homes in this community.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Thuok Narnn is 45 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a rice farmer and she also sells flowers at the local market. She is able to make about $2 of profit every day. 

Her husband has been operating a moto-taxi since 2000. On average, he is able to make about $5 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are garment factory workers and one is a student. 

Thuok Narnn is requesting a loan of $1200 to make two investments. She would like to reinvest $200 in her flower business and the rest is to invest in a fruit store.

loans.use: Invest in a fruit store and reinvest in flower business.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana M. is 57 years old and married, and she is the loving mother of one son. Tarana’s husband is currently unemployed, so her business is the main source of income for her family.

Tarana has a grocery store where she sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, detergents and other products. She has been in this business for ten years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Tarana is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. 

Tarana wants to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 1600 AZN to increase the inventory she has for sale.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 47, has five children with her husband Percibal.  She has been farming since 1996.  Judith now has two hectares of field where she and her husband plant rice crops.  She said that a financial shortage and climate changes bring challenges to her business.  There are times when her harvest is too little and there are also times it is just enough.  She wants to have an abundant harvest to be able to provide for the increasing needs of her household. 

Judith joined CEVI to gain financial support for her business.  She requests a loan of Php4, 000, to use to support her farm.  With that amount of money, she would be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Reynaldo's Group

texts.en:
Reynaldo T. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 44 years old. Reynaldo is the group leader of a seven member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Reynaldo is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Reynaldo and his wife own a business selling cosmetics and daily use products such as perfumes, talc powder, and make-up in the local community. Reynaldo is just starting this business.

In 2009, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Reynaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Margarita De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la comarca Rigoberto morales chavez, actualmente trabaja en el instituto señor de esquípulas, desempeñándose como secretaria
Es casada.
texts.en:
This client is from the Rigoberto Morales Chavez area. She is employed as a secretary at the Señor de Esquípulas Institute. She is married.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Home Improvements.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma A. is from the village of Olango. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $317 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Thelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP which again  will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Serigne Mory

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne Mory N. est un marchand ambulant depuis 7  ans. Il vend diverses marchandises comme du pain de singe, de l’arachide, du piment, poivre …. etc. Il compte avec son business nourrir sa femme et ses  trois petits enfants dont le plus âgé vient de souffler sa onzième bougie. D’ailleurs ce prêt va lui permettre de renforcer et de positionner son commerce
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne Mory N. has been a street vendor for seven years. He sells various articles such as “pain de singe” (baobab fruit), peanuts, pimento, pepper, and so on. He depends on this business to support his wife and three young children, the oldest of whom has just had to blow out the 11th candle on the birthday cake. This loan would allow him so strengthen his business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi Y. produces and sells palm kernel oil at Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and lives with her three children. She has no educational background. Esi uses the income she is able to generate from her sales to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more palm kernels to process for her palm kernel oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a nut-cracking machine which is going to reduce the time used to crack the nuts.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to process into palm kernel oil

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Mrs. Non C. lives in Trapeang Chak village in Prey Veng province. She is married with five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the others are attending the local public school.

She and her husband, Mr. Heab Chea, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they tried to work hard, they earn little income. So, to improve the living conditions of her family, she wants to start a new business, but she did not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Non C. is seeking a loan to buy a plowing machine to make more money. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine to make more money

loans.name: Fely Fuentivilla's Group

texts.en:
Fely F. is from P4 Embargo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years of age. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Fely F.'s Group'. 

Fely is married to Victor F., a carpenter and at the same time a farmer. They were blessed with 2 children; one is an adult and the other one is a teenager. Fely is engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from that, the family has support from her husband from his wage as a carpenter and income from their corn production activity. Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari store business and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from this activity. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for a year already.

 In April 2010, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member, she is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for her sari-sari store business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store business

location.town: Ozamis-P4 Embargo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya T. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and son in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her husband operates a taxi service business.

Narantuya operates a food retailing business out of a small shop. She started her business in 2008 with working capital of 200,000 MNT and, since then, it has reached 2,500,000 MNT.

Over the years, Narantuya has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to enlarge the business and purchase a bigger store than the current one."

Narantuya is an openminded, easygoing and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba N. is a hairdresser in Abura. She has received junior high education. She is married to a miner and has two children.

Aba has been a hairdresser for fifteen years and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams and other hair products to use on her customers’ hair.

Aba hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a steam dryer.

loans.use: To buy more hair creams and other hair products to use on her customers' hair

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Mitapasamanan Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Mitapasamanan inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias que son de la comunidad de Mitapasamanan, Distrito de Vinchos, se encuentra a 50 kilómetros de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
La señora Julia es la fiscal del Banco Comunal, Julia es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Julia se dedica a la compra de quesos en su comunidad y otros pueblos aledaños, sus ventas en la ciudad de Lima y Ayacucho, al inicio solo vendía en la feria de su Distrito, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo, Julia tiene proyectado dedicarse a la ganadería para producir leche, con su préstamo tiene proyectado comprar una vaca lechera.
Julia sueña con educar a sus hijos y tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The community bank named Santa Rosa de Mitapasamanan has started their third loan cycle. All 13 members are from the Mitapasamanan community in the Vinchos district, located 50 kilometers from the city of Ayacucho. The population is mostly made up of agriculturists and cattle farmers. Julia is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives together with her husband and their 4 children, all of whom are attending school. Julia sells cheeses in the community and in other neighboring cities, Lima and Ayacucho. She started out selling only in the fairs of the region but her business started to grow. Julia wants to dedicate her time to dairy farming. This loan will be used in the purchase of a dairy cow. Julia dreams of keeping her kids in school and to one day have a house in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a diary cow.

loans.name: Mrs. Savin Khit Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin K. is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sok Phorn Kry, is a construction worker. She is a weaver at her home in Kandal village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Savin K. is the village’s bank president, selected by the other seventeen members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Since Savin’s business is going well, she wants to expand, so she is applying for a loan to buy more silk. With the rest of the loan she will fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos; el tiene 29  años de edad y es soltero, el socio tiene un negocio de producción de alimentos, el los produce productos como haba, trigo y cebadas y después lo vende en diferentes tiendas y centros comerciales, el socio trabaja en forma independiente, él socio quiere tener un molino  y ampliar su pequeño negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar los productos al por mayor como haba y trigo. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”. This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq in the province and department of Cusco. Carlos is 29 years old and single. He has a food production business. He produces beans, wheat and barley and then sells them in various stores and commercial centers. He works independently. He wants to have a mill and expand his small business. He is seeking the loan to buy the goods, such as beans and wheat, wholesale. He is grateful to those that through this medium form part of this dream, and he commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans and wheat wholesale.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita joined ASHI in 2007, a KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans from Kiva, she invested the money in her business and later expanded the business by ordering a stock of ingredients to put into production. 

Now on her 4th loan, she has requested 16,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business ventures. She is positive that her business will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders at home. Tita is still hopeful that by growing her business of making and selling “bandi” (a sweet peanut delicacy) her profit will increase as well. Then she would be able to support her children’s education and hopefully will have a better career in the future.

“Bandi” is one of the most popular delicacies of Antique province and tourists buy it as a present. Demand for this product is increasing as the province industrializes. Tita wants to have a large amount of capital to increase her production, thus meeting the demands of her customers.

She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her “bandi” to earn a much larger income. She hopes to have success in a business that can provide her a good life that is moved out of poverty. Tita is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

loans.use: additional working capital for her making and selling "bandi" (a sweet peanut delicacy)

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Abdul, who is married, has three children aged 11, 7 and 1, and one additional dependent who lives with him to help with domestic work and to attend school.

In 2000, Abdul established his clothing business. Working six days a week and ten hours each day, he earns about Le 1,440,000 every month. Abdul is now requesting a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy jeans, shirts, and t-shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 288,000, and in the future he plans to further grow his business, build a house and educate his children. Abdul thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing for the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her brother's daughter). 

Mary has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Mary sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail. Mary has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Mary include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy another plot for building more rental rooms and to own a delivery van. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her work place and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Susana Tepkemoi

texts.en:
Susana Tepkemoi K. is 51 years old.  She is married to Silvester Kiplagat who is a farmer and is also a source of additional income for the family. They have four children of age 28, 26, 24, and 20 years.  Their residence is in Kapsowar in Eldoret Town. 

She has been operating a cereal store and at the same time selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 25 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 20,000.

Susana learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer.  She is applying for her first loan of Kshs 37,500 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy five sacks of maize and the remainder to buy one bale of second-hand clothes. 

With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees.   In the future, Susana wishes to build rental houses and live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy maize and second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit V. is a teacher; she lives in Sevkar village, Ijevan area, with her husband and her two daughters. One of her daughters is a student, and another is a schoolgirl. 

For several years Anahit worked at school as a teacher, but because of marriage and her children's birth, she quit her job. 

In 2003 Anahit opened a cosmetics business which she runs in Ijevan city. At her shop she sells creams, shampoos, hair dye, etc. This occupation allows her to cover part of her family's needs and pay for her elder daughter's education. 

Anahit is askng for a 200,000 AMD loan to buy articles of personal hygiene and perfumes to resell.

loans.use: To buy articles of personal hygiene and perfumes to resell

loans.name: 02.02.05-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hieu L. T. (30) is a 46-year-old femaL. living in the town of 02.02.05-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa. Hieu is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.02.05-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa.

Hieu is married with three adult-aged children. To making a living, Hieu operates a family member's business venture selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Hieu has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Hieu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to expand the business. This will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hieu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  C. T. Huong (31) is a 30-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  C. T. Lam (32) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  T. T. Ninh (33) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  L. T. Huong (34) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  P. T. Thuy (35) is a 22-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


6.  D. T. Men (36) is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


7.  N. T. Van (37) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hieu L. T. (30) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố 020205-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa.  Hieu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.02.05-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa (02.02.05-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm gia dụng cá nhân cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hieu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hieu kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hieu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  C. T. Huong (31) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  C. T. Lam (32) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  T. T. Ninh (33) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  L. T. Huong (34) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  P. T. Thuy (35) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


6.  D. T. Men (36) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  N. T. Van (37) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La señora Susana, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios para teléfonos móviles en un puesto en alquiler, ella indica que es su única forma de sustento para ayudar a sus Papas que ya son de edad avanzada, la semana anterior ella pasó unos cursos de decodificación e indica que el crédito que se le otorgara es para la compra de cajas para decodificación y de esta forma generar mayores ingresos para su familia por la creciente demanda que existe en la compra de teléfonos celulares, es una joven trabajadora y responsable que a su corta edad ya asume con los gastos de la casa, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Susana sells cell phones and accessories for mobile phones in a stand that she rents.  This is her only form of support to help her elderly parents.

Last week she passed some unlocking courses, and she will use the loan in order to buy the boxes to unlock phones.  This way she will generate more income for her family because there is a growing demand to buy cell phones.

She is a hard-working and responsible young woman.  At her young age she already assumes the household expenses.  She is very grateful to the institution for the help that has been offered.

loans.use: To buy cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Reda

texts.en: Reda is a 31 year-old married man who has worked as a van driver since 2001.  Reda transports students to and from school.  Reda started this business because he had problems finding a job with a good income.  He is improving his business and himself.  Reda is willing to expand his business through the addition of more vans.  He requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to conduct the necessary maintenance on his van.  His clients recommend him to their friends because of his honesty and loyalty.

loans.use: To make the necessary maintenance to his van

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon R., age 30, is a construction worker who lives in the province of Kompong Thom. Yon R. earns about 2.50 USD per day. His wife, Eang Thon, is a 33-year-old woman who makes a profit of about 2 USD per day by feeding pigs in the cage behind her house. They have only one child, who is studying in a local school. Yon R. sees that his wife's business is profitable for the family. Thus, he would like to request a loan to support his wife in buying more small pigs to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy more small pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: Mutoo Z.  est entrepreneur, secrétaire du groupe Faraja, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants.  Son conjoint est un comptable d’un établissement privée. Mutoo Z.  est vendeuse de friperie au petit marché sectoriel TMK.  Elle fait également le commerce des sacs à mains pour accroitre ses revenus. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari d’une valeur de 80$. Depuis 2000, elle exerce cette activité.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux articles (1 ballon de friperie et 1 ballon de sacs à mains).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et s’approvisionner dans les grands centres comme Dubaï. La cliente mutoo Z.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Faraja est constitué de 26 membres.
texts.en: Mutoo Z. is an entrepreneur and the secretary of the Faraja group. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of seven. Her spouse is an accountant in a private business. Mutoo Z. sells second-hand clothing at the local market in the TMK sector. She also sells handbags in order to increase her revenues. She had launched her business with her own starting capital in the amount of $80 received from her husband. She has been in this business since 2000. Later on she obtained a loan of $50,- from IMF Hekima. The new loan will allow her to stock up on goods (one sack of  second-hand clothing and one sack of handbags). In addition, her goal is to expand her business and to stock up in big cities such as Dubai. As a client of Hekima, Mutoo Z. is grateful for its work in support of the poor who are excluded from traditional banking. The Faraja group  is composed of 26 members.

loans.use: One sack of  second-hand clothing and one sack of handbags

loans.name: Bokk Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK DIOM est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009 au premier financement du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont du même village. Ces femmes sont unies par des liens d'amitié, de fraternité et d'affinité. 

Madame KINE S. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au grand marche de son village. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs 20 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer ses activité afin d'escompter des bénéfices plus importants. 

Son objectif est des subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The BOKK DIOM solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009 at the first funding of the Banc Villageois of DIADIORDE, to which it belongs. It is composed of 15 women from the same village who are united by ties of friendship, sisterhood and affinity.

Mrs. KINE S. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of eight children.

She sells vegetables at the grand marketplace of her village. She also fattens sheep, an activity she has been practicing for about 20 years.

Her new loan will allow her to better develop her business in order to increase her profits. Her goal is to provide for her children’s needs and support her husband with the family’s financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Mayra Clara

texts.es:
Mayra, tiene 45 años de edad, reside en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos, trabaja de lunes a viernes y prepara yuca, enchiladas, tamales, pasteles, entre otros.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en productos como yucas, maíz, tomates, plátanos, bananos, condimentos. Estos son parte de sus materiales para preparar la venta, así con esta compra espera tener lo necesario y continuar su rutina diaria.
Ella quiere seguir en el negocio, proveer todo lo necesario para su familia y ver la posibilidad que su hija continúe en sus estudios  y que al crecer también se prepare con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Mayra is 45 years old and lives in Nueva Guadalupe, in San Miguel department, with her family.  She has an 8 year-old daughter.  Mayra works selling traditional meals.  She works from Monday to Friday and prepares cassava, enchiladas, tamales, pies and other dishes.

Mayra is currently requesting a loan to invest in products such as cassava, corn, tomatoes, bananas, plantains and condiments.  These are some of the supplies she uses in preparing her dishes.  She hopes this purchase will mean that she has what she needs and that she will be able to continue in her daily routine.

Mayra would like to continue in her business, provide her family with everything they need and enable her daughter to continue with her studies.  As she grows up, she hopes that her daughter will continue on to university.

loans.use: To buy cassava, corn, tomatoes, bananas, plantains and condiments

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman K. is 60, married and has two sons who are 1 and 3 years old. His family lives in Sabirabad city. Zaman sells household items and children's clothes in his shop. This business has become the only source of income for Zaman`s family. Zaman already has successfully paid his loan and now applied for new one.

Zaman has been in the trade for 12 years. His business is characterized by stability and positive performance. The inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwashers, laundry soap, towels, dishes, perfumes, and other household items and children need seasonal clothes. 
Zaman wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: to purchase more houshold items to sell

loans.name: Dandy

texts.en:
Dandy E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 38 years old. Dandy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dandy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The income for the business comes primarily from buying and raising pigs for sale. Dandy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dandy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dandy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and eventually sell. Dandy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Dandy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a 43-year-old lady originally from Jombang-East Java Province, is married to Lukas and has been blessed with two children: Diva, who is 3 years old, and Glen, who is aged 3 months. When they got married, Lukas, a widower, also brought four children from his first marriage, so Maria is also taking care of them. They all reside in Airnona Village.

Living with six children is not easy for Maria, as there are many things they need to be provided with such as food, education, clothes, etc. Moreover, they are growing up, requiring Maria and her husband to work even harder to generate money. Because Lukas doesn’t have a permanent job, he cannot provide a stable monthly income, so Maria took the initiative to start a kiosk business eight months ago, using her own capital. She is a kind-hearted woman willing to help her husband meet their daily needs.

Maria heard that TLM provides a loan program to small entrepreneurs, and because she wants to improve her business is now requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to purchase items for her kiosk such as eggs, biscuits, snacks, instant noodles etc. She hopes that TLM is willing to provide the loan for the improvement of her business and family welfare in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items for the kiosk such as eggs, biscuits, snacks, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide, des fruits et du tiéké.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouman sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de l’arachide, des fruits et du tiéké.                                                                        
La cliente FATOUMATA C. compte acheter de l’arachide avec les revendeurs. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, de la nourriture pour les enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Dembagnouman group are all married, average 37 years of age with three children each and live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They met each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They all trade in peanuts, fruits and "tiéké" (a cassava-based food).

The women in the Dembagnouman group are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy peanuts, fruit and "tiéké". 

The customer, Fatoumata C. is planning to buy peanuts from retailers. She sells her products in the village square for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs which will be used to make her loan repayments and to buy food for her children. The balance will be reinvested in her trading activity.

loans.use: to by peanuts

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri de 49 años de edad, esta casada con Esteban de 51 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicado en el distrito de  Kimbiri. Julia, se dedica al negocio, en su puesto de ventas vende refrescos de fruta, propias de la zona de donde vive, del mismo modo vende frutas variadas como: plátano, mango, piña, pacay y frutos cítricos. Por otro lado percibe ingresos en la venta de panes, en donde los expende en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Kimbiri con la ayuda de sus hijos. Julia, sabe administrar su tiempo, empieza desde la madruga, a las 04 de la mañana se  dirige a la panadería a recoger los panes,  para luego ser vendidos en la calle, donde se establece en alguna esquina para expenderlos. Luego se dirige a su puesto de venta de frutas, donde vende también sus refrescos. Han transcurrido 15 años, y gracias a estos trabajos pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos y completar con su educación Sus planes para el futuro es abrir una fuente de soda, y poder ganar más dinero. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y asegura que no dejará de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente agradece a la institución por cederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará frutas variadas para su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Julia, a native of the city of Kimbiri, is 49 years old. She is married to Esteban, age 51, and they have 3 children. They live in their own house located in the district of Kimbiri.

Julia has a business. In her stall she sells fruit drinks made from fruit grown in the area where she lives. She also sells local fruits such as bananas, mangos, pineapples, and citrus fruits. In addition, she receives income from selling breads. With help from her children she sells in the central zone of the city of Kimbiri.

Julia knows how to manage her time. She begins her day very early in the morning. At 4:00 a.m. she goes to the bakery to collect bread which she will later sell in the street on a corner where establishes herself for making these sales. Later, she goes to her fruit selling stall where she also sells drinks. She has been doing this for 15 years, and, thanks to these jobs, her children have progressed and finished their education. Her plans for the future are to open a soda fountain and to earn more money.

This is Julia’s sixth loan with MFP and she will be sure to make her payments on time. She is grateful to the institution for giving her the loan. With the loan applied for she will purchase various fruits to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelipue is a Rwandan entrepreneur that runs a store.  She has been running her business for five years and so far used the profits from it to build her family a house.

Angelipue is married to a mechanic and together they have two children that are 2.5 and 4 years old.  They are not yet in school as they are still too young.

She will use this loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and charcoal that she will sell as her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business to accumulate savings that will allow her to renovate her house.

Angelipue’s goal for her business is that it will grow three times larger, continuing to provide for herself and her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and charcoal that she can sell in her business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marife has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 11, 9, and 6. She has been driving a taxi for over a year making 23,000 KES a month. This is Florence’s first loan. She plans to use it to purchase spare parts needed to service her vehicle. She intends to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a fleet of five vehicles for her business and thus create employment for other people.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her taxi

loans.name: Zeidine

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 22ans, Zeidine achète des tricots, chemise et Lacoste  au grand marché de Lomé. Il est célibataire et veut ce premier montant pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux préparer sa vie future maritale.
texts.en: Zeidine is a young man of 22, who buys sweaters, shirts, and t-shirts at the big market in Lomé.He is unmarried and requests this first loan to enhance his business in order to prepare for his future as a married man.

loans.use: purchase sweaters and shirts.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages, & snacks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks. 

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks

loans.name: Roxana De Jesus

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su esposo y sus hijos,tiene una venta de ropa y de pan, estos negocios surgieron por iniciativa propia, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes ya que los negocios los tiene en su casa y pasa tiempo completo en ellos.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra camisas, pantalones, faldas y más mercadería que es demanda por sus clientes para sus negocios, esta compra le ayudara en variar la venta de ropa y tener más materia prima para la elaboración del pan. 
Ella quiere mejorar sus negocios y sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y ser un buen cliente con moral de pago, para tener la oportunidad de crecer en el comercio.
texts.en:
Roxana, who lives with her husband and children, sells clothes and bread.  These businesses came about due to her own initiative.  She does not have  fixed business hours to attend to her customers as she works from her home and spends her full time on the businesses.

Roxana needs a loan to buy shirts, pants, skirts and other merchandise that is in demand by customers for her business.  This acquisition will help her to vary the clothes she sells and give her more raw materials for making bread.

She wants to improve her business and increase revenue for the welfare of her family. She is a good client with good ethics in payment.  She is grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Abdilgozi

texts.ru: Абдилгози проживает в районе Яван. Ему 56 лет. Он женат, имеет семерых детей. Образование у него среднее. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он уже более двадцати лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы. Абдилгози хочет увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Abdilgozi lives in the Yavan district.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children.  He has a secondary education.  He earns his living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for over twenty years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.  Abdilgozi wants to increase his livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 58-year-old married man with five children, living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to have many income generating projects. At the moment he operates a school and has a produce store, besides farming. James now needs the loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past five years he has operated a fruit selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. Mohamed faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Mohamed is applying for our Sikukuu product which was launched for the Muslims celebration. With the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents for personal use. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents for personal use.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La Señora Maria está casada con el señor Sindulfo hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos menores que aún están en la escuela primaria. Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en un barrio muy poblado D. la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados. Gracias al trabajo que estan realizando estan educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades D. su hogar.
Ella comenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo y sacrificio ella, junto con la ayuda D. su marido ha logrado mantener a u familia. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que diariamente acuden hasta su local para comprar D. ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás para abastecer su local.
texts.en:
Señora Maria has been married to Señor Sindulfo for several years,  They have four young children who are still in primary school.  Together they set up a store in their home, which is located in a highly-populated neighborhood in the area.  They began with a small amount of capital which they got from other work they had done previously as salaried employees.

Thanks to their work, they are educating their children and buying everything they need for their household.

She comments that thanks to her hard work and self-sacrifice, she has been able to support her family with the help of her husband.  She comments that she has many customers who come to her premises every day to buy from her.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of food, drinks, dairy products and other things for stocking up her premises.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products and other things.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James wants a loan to acquire digital satellite television equipment for his salon. In his efforts to set up a beauty salon, he feels it is necessary to keep his clients entertained. He acquired his initial capital from farming and his dream is to have the most modern salon in town.

loans.use: to acquire digital satellite television equipment.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTO DOMINGO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: trenzado de mantas, venta de verduras, tejido para mantas, macramé, tienda de barrio.

La señora Juana  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de bolsas con la técnica de macramé que viene trabajando hace veinte años atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su mamá 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra una hilo cola de rata) que comprará de las ferias y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los intereses y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SANTO DOMINGO" will begin its first term with Pro Mujer, which is run at the Villa Adela Center.  The group is comprised of six members and led by a management board presided over by Mrs. Juana.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varried and include: blanket braiding, vegetable sales, blanket weaving, macramé and running a neighborhood store.

Mrs. Juana says that this is her first term working with Pro Mujer and she joined by invitation from another member.  Currently she runs a macramé bag weaving business.  She has been working for 20 years and learned the skill from her mother.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (to buy rattail cord at the fairs) so she can make her products and fill orders.  This type of job allows her to earn an income and help support her family.  She is married and has four children.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that the interest rate and savings are good.

loans.use: To buy cord.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr:
Ayawavi est une femme âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en douanes. Ils ont 04 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier a 08ans.
Ayawavi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale (riz, savon huile végétale…) depuis 2003. Elle vend à la maison après achat  à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente. 
Ayawavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Elle veut épargner le profit réalisé. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayawavi voudrait augmenter son stock. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayawavi is a 40-year-old woman.  She is married to a customs broker.  They have four children who are all in school.  Their eldest is 18 years old and their youngest is 8 years old.

Ayawavi has been working as a food retailer (rice, soap, vegetable oil...) since 2003.  She sells her products from home after having bought them in Lomé. Her main difficulty is a slump in sales.

Ayawavi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to re-invest in her business.  She would like to save her profits.

Over the coming years, Ayawavi would like to increase her stock.  She says that she plans to use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Orland

texts.en:
Orland is from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Orland raises and sells pigs. 

Orland expresses his thanks to Kiva lenders with a loan he took out via Kiva and for the help he received from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. Orland was able to expand his business.  He purchased a piglet to raise and sell.  As a result of his efforts he had an excellent profit and is repaying his loan on time.
