Mary Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Mary Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. Judith is married. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith says she learned farming from her parents who were also both farmers. 

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Judith from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir I. is 51 years old and he makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with three children. Over the years, he has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. He sells cattle to the local farmers and butchers. His monthly income ranges between about $315 and $415.

Now Mahir has applied for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and increase his income. The loan will greatly improve Mahir’s income and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Indyiboneye Group

texts.fr:
Beatha Mukakizima, née à Ruhuha l’Est du Rwanda, il a 37 ans, il est marié et il a 4 enfants, son ainé a 13 ans et son cadet a 2 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Elle vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. Un seul enfant va à l’école.
Elle appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé INDYIBONEYE cultivateurs de riz,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Béate et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les engrais chimique pour felitiliser leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Béate Mukakizima was born in Ruhuha, in eastern Rwanda. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. Her eldest is 13 years old and her youngest is 2 years old. She has completed primary school. She lives with her family in Ruhuha Bugesera. Only one of her children goes to school. She belongs to Indyiboneye, a solidarity group of rice growers who guarantee each other’s loans. Béate and her group work to support their families, to improve their quality of life and to pay their children’s tuition fees. The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy chemical fertiliser for their fields. When the group harvests their crops, part of it is sold and the rest is saved for their families.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertiliser

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora L. es una persona de bajos recursos, por motivos de dinero ella solo alcanzo a estudiado hasta 2º de secundaria, ya que tuvo que dedicarse al trabajo desde muy temprana edad, actualmente es soltera debido a un fracaso conyugal, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son independientes(mayores de edad), y uno de ellos aún depende de la señora Teodora.    

La señora se dedica a la producción de pan y a la atención de una tiendita de barrio que esta ubicada en la casa de una de sus hijas, con el dinero que genera mantiene su hogar y hace estudiar a su hijo de 8 años. 

La señora necesita  $us. 1200.- para poder sutir su tienda y asi mejorar su situación economica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teodora L. is a person of few means. She was only able to study through the second grade because she could not afford it and had to work starting at a very young age. She is single following a failed marriage. She has three children, two of whom are grown and one still depends on Ms. Teodora. 

She makes bread and tends a small neighborhood store that is located in the house of one of her daughters. She uses the money the store generates to maintain her home and put her 8 year old son through school. 

She needs $1200 to be able to stock the store and this way, improve her and her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito R. is from the town of Banga. He is 61 years old, married and has 7 children. His eldest child is 36 years old and the younger ones still go to school. Anecito owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He works hard to help provide for his family. He also supports his children who still go to school.

Anecito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Anecito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nhoung

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoung R. is a 40-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Nhoung R. is married to Mr. Chan Lorn, age 40. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to three children, all of whom are single. Due to the coming harvesting season, Mrs. Nhoung R. should generate around $2.33 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. This is the rice harvesting season so Mrs. Nhoung R. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.name: Forcused Women's Group

texts.en:
T. Catherine is the leader of her lending group, Forcused Women's Group, in Kihihi. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. all in school. She also takes care of other dependents.

Catherine has been operating a hotel and retail shop in Kihihi market for 2 years and she is able to make a weekly profit of 100,000 UGX. Catherine’s customers are mostly within the town of Kihihi. She says that she started her business with capital from agriculture and that she has been able to expand it by being cooperative, friendly and hardworking. Her dream is to be able to expand on a large scale and for her family to develop. Catherine needs a loan in order to restock her business with more foodstuffs for the hotel and general merchandise for the shop.

loans.use: to restock her shop and buy foodstuffs for her hotel

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia O. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Evelia is separated from her spouse and has four adult-aged children. Evelia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Evelia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month. She has chosen to lower her loan from 18,000 pesos to 5,000 pesos because it is easier to pay.

In 2005, Evelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Evelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Evelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages and snack foods. This will be her nineteenth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like beverages and snack food

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luis Alfonso C. C., es mayor de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio de las frutas y verduras, es agricultor desde hace 22 años, ellos son una familia de 4 hijos mayores que trabajan y apoyan a sus padres en las labores del hogar, en el negocio se ha enfrentado a problemas de infección de insectos y fue con el apoyo de su esposa y su esfuerzo propio que su finca ha sido de buena bonanza, el solicita un préstamo para erradicar el problema de las plagas, a favor de que la producción se multiplique y favorezca las ventas, a futuro espera que se pueda, diversificar las cosechas por otras que le sean más rentables y mejoren día a día sus condiciones socio económicas, así como la remodelación de su casita para sus días de retiro con su esposa.
texts.en: Luis Alfonso C. C. is an elderly gentleman.  He is married and his wife sells fruits and vegetables.  Luis Alfonso has been a farmer for 22 years.  He and his wife have four grown-up children who work and support their parents with the household chores.  In his business, Luis Alfonso has faced problems with insect infestations but, with the support of his wife and through his own hard work, his farm has been very successful.  He is requesting a loan to eradicate the problem of insect infestations so that his production will increase and he will enjoy better sales.  In the future, he hopes that he will be able to diversify his harvests, growing other products that will be more profitable.  He also hopes to improve his socio-economic conditions from day to day and to remodel his small home for his retirement together with his wife.

loans.use: To maintain plant health

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha sells a large variety of items in her boutique. She is 44 years old, married to a farmer and has owned her boutique for the last three years. She will use her loan to buy more items to sell, including books, lotions, biscuits, salt, sugar, rice, soaps and cooking oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay her children's school fees, reinvest in her business and buy food for her family. Her goal in the future is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell, such as salt, sugar, rice, lotions and stationery.

loans.name: Charry Joy

texts.en: Charry Joy B.'s main source of income comes from making and selling general household furniture like wood cabinets and sala sets to local businesses and community members. She is 22 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Charry Joy has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Charry Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Charry Joy is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This will be her sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a hardworking person.  He makes an effort to give his beloved children the best.   Rashid decided to stay on his land so that he can develop it.  Now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.  

With the experience gained over 5 years in the purchasing and sales of cattle, Rashid has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase additional cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason he has requested a loan for USD1500.  Rashid thanks you very much for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand business

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan S. was born in 1976, and she lives in Tuol Krang village in Kadnal province. She is a seamstress in a garment factory where she is able to earn a small salary to support her family. Aside from her work as a seamstress, she also earns her living by selling groceries at her home. Since her business is doing well, she would like to expand it. She is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to support her business. 

Her husband, Mr. Him Vith, who is in the picture with her, was born in 1977, and is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice for a living.    He also helps in his wife's business. This couple has two children who attend the local school and also help their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to support her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a shop for this business and improve it

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en: Sadaf Ibarahimova is a 57-year-old woman living in Bilasuvar. She is married with three children. She and her husband breed cattle to earn a living. They began to raise livestock 15 years ago. This is Sadaf's first loan, and the extra income she expects to earn will be invested into the family's cattle-breeding business. She used this loan to buy two cows and feed for her animals. The support of this loan helps her to financially meet the needs of her family. The monthly income of the family has increased to 350 AZN. Sadaf and her husband plan to expand their dairy farming operation in the future.

loans.use: to buy two cows and feed for animals

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa E. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Marisa is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Marisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits,  shampoo, soap & candies in the local community. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital. 

Marisa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn V., 46, a resident of Admin Site, Tala, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gilberto V., a security officer, and is the mother of three children, two of whom are already working. The other child is still studying in college. At this time, Marilyn is working hard to be able to send her youngest child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Marilyn, as she herself has been a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Marilyn runs a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in small amounts to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos' worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located next to her house. Marilyn also sells viands (prepared dishes) just beside her small variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue running her businesses, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also use part of this loan to purchase raw ingredients for her food stall. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of god she receives. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the word of god, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks for her store and raw ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 42 years old and married, with two children who are 14 and 19 years old. She also takes care of three children who are between 14 and 22 years old.  Francoise sells sacks of charcoal in her store. Her business is well-organized. She has two years of experience in her business and she works from 5:30 A.M. until 9 P.M. every day except Sunday. She currently employs two people to help her.

Francoise has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell, so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Francoise will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Duo Esmeraldas De Tecpan Group

texts.es: Duo Esmeraldas de Tecpan: Este grupo esta formado por dos señoras,Maria Rosa se dedica al fabricacion de chocolates desde ahce  ya barios años ella tiene tres hijos mayores de edad que aun no se han graduado ella fabrica chocolates y jaleas de diferentes frutas naturales ella entraga pedidos en diferentes municipios ella nos cuenta que su negocio ha mejorado desde que le dieron el credito anterior ella nos cuenta que sus ganacias mejoraron y que ella se siente realizada ya que es un gran apoyo para su familia esta muy agradecida con Dios por las bendiciones que el le a concedido y tambien muy agradecida con Fape por el apoyo brindado atravez de los creditos ella solicita este credito para la compra de frutas para elavorar jalea y chocolates el sueño mas grande de ella es agr4andar su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean personas de bien,la siguiente socia solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para dama ya que ella tabien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y nececita capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
This group, “Duo Esmeraldas de Tecpan”, is composed of two women. Maria Rosa has been making chocolates for several years. She has 3 older children who have not graduated as yet. She makes chocolates and jelly from different natural fruits. Maria Rosa fulfills orders from several municipalities. She reports that her business has improved since receiving her last loan. She is sure that her earnings will continue to improve and she feels fulfilled since this is a real help for her family. Maria Rosa is very grateful to God for the blessings she has received and also, very grateful to Fape for the help it offers by means of these loans. 

The loan will be used to buy fruits for making jellies as well as chocolates. Rosa Maria's greatest dreams are to expand her business and for her children to continue their studies and become good people.

The second group member solicits this loan to purchase ladies' cosmetics. In addition to working with Maria Rosa, she sells cosmetics and needs to invest in order to work.

loans.use: to buy fruits for making jelly, and chocolates,and to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Alasa

texts.en:
Alasa is 42 years of age and is married with five children. Alasa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Alasa needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 150 WST or 63  USD per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Alasa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Alasa's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Romeo has a shop that makes and sells home-made ice cream. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.
Romeo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. Christina sells rice, cassava and banku at Elmina. Banku is a staple made from corn. 

She wants to increase the quantity of banku she cooks and so a loan of 200 Ghanaian cedis (GHS) will help her buy a bag of corn and other ingredients to cook to sell. The new profit as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of corn and other ingredients to cook to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and textiles

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, a 56-year-old widowed mother of six, works hard to support her children by growing rice to sell in Banga, South Cotabato.  She also sells dried fish to the people in her community. Rosemarie is now requesting a loan to purchase three sacks of seeds, two sacks of fertilizers, and two quarts of herbicides. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of seeds, 2 sacks of fertilizers and 2 quarts of herbicides

loans.name: Duvan De Jesus

texts.es:
Duvan, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, es agricultor y ganadero, su padre le enseño esta labor, y ha logrado mantener a su familia de las ganancias que le dan la agricultura y la ganaderia.
El esta realizando la siembra de maiz, para esto solicita un prestamo que cubra el gasto de abono y fertilizantes, pues estos materiales son necesarios para fortalecer la milpa y prevenirla de plagas.
su aspiracion es aumentar el terreno de cultivo y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Duvan lives with his wife and four children. He is a farmer and a rancher. His father taught him this trade and now Duvan is able to support his family with the revenue he generates from farming and raising livestock.

He just finished planting corn, so he is requesting a loan to cover the cost of buying compost and fertilizers. These supplies are needed to strengthen his cornfield and prevent pests.

His aspirations are to increase his farmland and to support his children so that they can succeed.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Babi

texts.fr:
Babi est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 02 enfants.  
Babi travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux, des bazins, des chaussures et des mèches depuis 2003. Elle sert ses clients dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Babi a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Babi is a 34-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has two children. 

Babi has been working as a retailer of jewelry, damask cloth, footwear, and hair extensions since 2003. She serves her customer in a shop. She purchases her goods in Lomé.

Babi has requested her third loan at the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, hair extensions, and damask cloth

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia lives in the town of Dauis, Bohol with her family. She makes rice cakes, polvoron, and tablea. Pelagia sells her products to the people in her community. She also sells dried fish.  She works hard to provide for her family’s needs.

Pelagia requested this loan to purchase more dried fish to sell and ingredients like flour and sugar. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: purchase fish, flour and sugar

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from home to the market. Omar faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, es casada, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años.
Alejandra vende agregados para construcción (piedra chancada, arena fina, arena de asentar, hormigón y mas), recuerda que cuándo empezó no tenía mucho capital y no le querían dar préstamo en ningún Banco, ella agradece que Finca confió en ella y gracias a eso ahora esta progresando, el apoyo moral que dan, con las capacitaciones tiene mucho valor parar ella, ahora gracias a su esfuerzo y la responsabilidad que le enseñaron pudo salir adelante. Con este préstamo comprará arena y hormigón. Su meta es poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the 'Solución' community bank. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years.

Alejandra sells construction aggregates (gravel, fine sand, mortar, concrete, etc.)  She recalls that when she started out she didn't have a lot of capital and none of the banks wanted to give her a loan.  She is grateful that FINCA trusted her and, thanks to this, she is now making progress.  She finds the moral support that FINCA provides and the training sessions they give to be of great value.  Now, thanks to her hard work and the responsibility that they have taught her, she has been able to get ahead in life.  She will use this loan to buy sand and concrete.  Her goal is to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy sand and concrete

loans.name: Tania P.

texts.fr: Mariée, Tania vit avec ses 5 enfants dans sa maison familiale. Les enfants sont tous scolarisés. Tania a pour activité la vente de divers articles tels que les produits alimentaires, les boissons, les glacières et autres articles au marché Fifadji, un des marchés de la ville de Cotonou. Ses clients ont constitués des usagers du marché et de ses environs. Elle fait ses achats dans les marchés de Cotonou. Tania  a décidé de renouveler son 8ème crédit à FINADEV pour achalander sa boutique de divers articles afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par le micro crédit lui permettra d'aider son mari au foyer.
texts.en:
Tatiana is married and lives with her five children in her family home. All children have attended school. Tatiana sells various items such as foodstuffs, beverages, coolers, etc. at the Fifadji market, in the city of Cotonou. Her customer base consists of market-goers and local shoppers. She buys her stock in the Cotonou markets. 

Tatiana has renewed her eighth loan with FINADEV. She will stock up on merchandise for her shop in order to better meet customer demand. The extra revenue earned through this credit will allow her to help her husband with the household responsibilities.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stones, silver chains, silver hooks and silver decorations

loans.name: Mayeba

texts.fr:
Mayeba  est  un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est célibataire et sans enfants.
Mayeba travaille comme ouvrier depuis 2008. Il est employé dans une entreprise de la place(INDUPLAST) en tant que machiniste.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas avoir un moyen de transport pour se rendre à son travail. 
Mayeba a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une moto pour se rendre à son travail à temps.
texts.en:
Mayeba is a 29-year-old man.  He is single and doesn't have any children.

Mayeba has been working as a laborer since 2008.  He is employed in a local company (INDUPLAST) as a machinist.  At the moment, his main difficulty is that he doesn't have a mode of transport for getting to work.

Mayeba has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy a motorbike so that he can get to work on time.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his personal use

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is aged 35 and married with three children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For over 4 years, Elvie has been engaged in the business of running a general store in the local community, selling a variety of food and home-use products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap and other items. She earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month with her business.

Elvie joined GDMPC in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to use for purchasing additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 27 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Melody has a business selling viands (a traditional Filipino dish). She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. Melody has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy meat and other ingredients for her viand vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Melody would like to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meat and other ingredients for her viand vending business.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías desde hace siete años vende lo que es ropa típica  accesorios como son collares, aretes  y anillos.
Lo que mas le gusta de  su negocio es acomodar su mercancía y exhibirla y darles una buena atención a sus clientes.
También cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para poder tener más ganancias y hacer su tienda de artesanías más grande.
Ella pidió  el préstamo para comprar más mercancía  más como son vestidos tipicos, blusas, aretes y collares.
Esta muy agradecida con fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir con su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.
texts.en:
Señora Eusebia is single and has no children. She has been selling handicrafts for the last 7 years. The handicrafts consist of traditional clothing, accessories such as necklaces, earrings and rings.

What she likes the most about her business is arranging and displaying her goods and giving her customers good service. She also has a small grocery store so as to have more income and expand her handicraft shop. She asked for the loan to purchase more merchandise such as traditional dresses, blouses, earrings and necklaces. She is very grateful to the Fundacion for the support given her to continue with her small business and make it grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Ordaly

texts.en:
Ordaly is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Ordaly has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ordaly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ordaly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is taking this loan out for her son, student Binh, a student who is attending Hanoi National Agricultural University. His tuition duration lasts four years and he will graduate in 2014. After graduation, he wishes to work for the local department for ground source management as an officer. To make this dream come true, he is studying hard to achieve the best results. Mrs. Huong is asking for a loan of 10,206,000 VND to pay for Binh's school fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 40-year-old business woman who owns a posho mill. She is married to Ezra, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children, ages 20, 17, 14, 11, six and two.

She has worked in her posho mill for one year and earns a monthly income of  21,590 KES. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD to buy more maize to stock in her business. 

The profit she gets would help her buy more maize. Her dreams are to build rental houses and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en:
Nuraddin is 51 years old. He is married and has three daughters and one son. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. For the past 15 years, Nuraddin has been breeding cattle and cows. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolmas. 

He usually buys calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, then sells them at a profit at the local livestock bazaar. He also keeps milk cows for his family’s use and for making milk products such as yogurt to sell to his neighbors. His son helps him in this business. His monthly profit is 170 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

Nuraddin is applying for a 2,000 AZN loan. This will be his seventh loan, and he has a good client history. He wants to improve his business and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves to sell in future

loans.name: Sangali

texts.ru:
Сангали 31 летный мужчина. Он женат и умеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка и присматривает за детьми. Сангали с детства Сангали мечтал стать геологом. Ему нравится работе геологов. По этой причине он после школы поступил в университет, кафедры гологии.
     Геологи  своей деятельностью должны нести систематически четырехстороннюю нагрузку. Их обязанность работать регулярно в поле, изучать вещество, следить за развитием науки и выступать с результатами своих исследований в печати. Геологи много времени проводят в поле, работают в малонаселенных районах и горах. Главные орудия геолога - геологический молоток, карандаш и блокнот для документации обнажений и записи придуманных гипотез. 
Сангали 8 лет занимается с любимой работой. Он очень рад, что нашел свою работу. Сангали много лет жил в старом доме, и он хочет отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить жилищные условия детей и жены. Но, к сожалению, он не смог копить денег для ремонта. И Сангали решил обратиться к Вам за кредитом. Он нуждается на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Sangali is a 31-year-old man. He is married and has three children. His wife is a home-maker and looks after the children. Sangali dreamed of becoming a geologist from his childhood. He likes geologists' work. For this reason after graduating from school he went to university, to the geology faculty.

I believe that geologists should conduct their business systematically in four directions. Their duty is to work regularly in the field; to study materials; to follow developments in science; and to announce the results of their research in print. Geologists spend a lot of time in the field, working in sparsely populated regions and mountains. A geologist's main tools are a geologist's hammer, a pencil and a notebook for documenting outcroppings and noting conceived hypotheses. Sangali has been doing his favorite work for eight years. He is very glad that he found this work.

Sangali has lived in an old house for many years, and he wants to renovate his house and improve his children's and wife's living conditions. Unfortunately, he has not been able to save up money for the renovations and Sangali has decided to turn to you for a loan. He has need of financial support.

loans.use: to renovate his home.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge is  years old and he is father of 2 kids he works as a driver and he pays rent he needs a loan to fix his car Jorge would like to buy a house for his family in the future he hopes you can help him because he is the only support for his family

loans.use: to fix his car

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Aného in Togo, Mrs Véronique A. is married and the mother of six (6) children. Her husband, who retired 5 years ago, is unable to meet the family’s needs as his pension is very insufficient. Working as a weaver and selling the mats she creates, Mrs A. is able to provide for her family with her small revenue. She has just received a large order for a special line of 400 mats. The order comes from a centre which trains juvenile delinquents. The mats ordered are of a large size and require more work because the logo of the centre needs to be inserted. Mrs A. and her team don’t have the necessary resources to do the work. She is asking for a loan of $750 to buy the needed materials and to hire a few people so the work will be done quickly. This order will increase her sales a lot and change her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Aného, Madame A. Véronique est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Son époux en retraite depuis 5 ans n’arrive plus à assumer les charges de la famille car sa pension de retraite est très insuffisante. Exerçant comme activité le tissage et la vente des nattes, Madame A. arrive à subvenir aux charges du ménage avec son petit revenu. Elle vient de recevoir une importante commande de 400 nattes d’une gamme spéciale. Avec son équipe, elle a décidé de satisfaire cette commande provenant d’un centre de formation pour jeunes délinquants. Les nattes commandées sont de grandes dimensions et demandent plus de travail parce qu’il faut y insérer le logo du centre. Seulement, Madame A. n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour faire ce travail. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $750 pour acheter les matériaux de fabrication et engager quelques personnes pour que le travail soit rapide. Cette commande va beaucoup augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et changer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: buy materials to make mats

loans.name: Previlus

texts.en:
Previlus A. is a single mother of two children. She runs a small clothing stand selling mainly women's sandals and clothing. This loan will allow her to expand her inventory so that she can turn a larger profit and take her business to the next level. Her sales are increasing as are her long trips to the larger markets outside her home city of Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. With the earnings she is making by selling her goods, she can only buy enough to last a few days before she must replenish her stock. The long journey to the market takes her away from her business and her children.

NOTE: Previlus is one of 10 micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $1,200 loan together. Previlus' group will receive and pay back this loan together - if a member is unable to pay in full on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. Investors in this loan will receive an update on Previlus' situation as well as that of the entire group. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Expand the inventory of ten businesses

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
My name is Beatriz M.. I worked as a corn miller, this work is very good because many people need to mill their corn to make tortilla dough. Because of tortillas are part of the basic meal in our communities, people mill a lot of corn. At this moment, I have problem with the miller engine and I need to repair it to worker better with my customers and therefore to generate more revenue; which is necessary to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Beatriz M. me dedico a moler maiz, este trabajo es muy bueno ya que mucha gente necesita moler su maiz para hacer masa para las tortillas y como las tortillas son un alimento indispensable en nuestra comunidad la gente muele mucho maiz, en estos momentos tengo problemas con el motor de mi molino y necesito repararlo para poder atender mejor a mis clientes y asi generar mas ganancias las cuales las necesito para alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motor of my mill, water, and oil.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru:
Musharaf O., 50 is a married mother of 7 daughters. She has been raising cattle for 9 years. Musharaf’s husband works as a driver and her two daughters work at a confectionery. Musharaf began her cattle business since she moved to dacha.* Then, she had a cow and a calf. In 2005, when Musharaf joined MicroInvest, she received $150 loan. Gradually, she expanded the size of her farm and increased the number of cattle. Musharaf improved quality of life for her family. She increased her business assets to $1000 on which she receives $600 income. In the future, Musharaf plans to increase the variety and headcount of her livestock.

*TRANSLATOR’S NOTE. The meaning of the word dacha,as it used here, is different from that commonly found in an English dictionary. Since the late 80s, it became increasingly popular in the former USSR republics for the local government to sell or distribute small parcels of lend to people (oftentimes as small as 20 x 20 meters) for building dachas or summer houses. Since collapse of the USSR, many dacha owners turned them into tiny farms to feed their families.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Окилова Мушараф - 50 лет. Замужем, имеет семь дочек, опыт в скотоводстве 9 лет. Муж работает шофером, двое дочерей работают в кондитерском цехе. Начала заниматься животноводством, когда переехала на дачный участок, тогда она имела корову с теленком. Клиентом «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, она получила 150$. Постепенно она расширила место откорма и приобрела несколько видов скота. Также она улучшила уровень жизни своей семьи. Сейчас ее активы возросли до 1000$ и она получает 600$. В будущем планирует приобрести не только крупнорогатый скот, но и другие виды скотов.

loans.use: To increase the total number of livestock

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
I live in Multan, a small city in Pakistan, but one with a lot of old ruins and shrines of many saints. I have been a textile artist since I was 10. It is our family business, however, I wish that my children pursue an education and acquire some good job after their study completion. I would rather they pursue a career instead of adopting our family business as their profession.

For a living, I knit bags, shawls, and covers, which currently yields me inadequate amounts to make ends meet. I buy wool on credit from my neighbor who charges me with very high prices. However, if I buy the wool on cash from the market, it will be cheaper and will leave me with higher profits. I am asking for a loan of USD 250.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Clara Francisca

texts.es:
Sra. Clara belongs to the Las Rosas de Yungay group. She earns a living selling men's and women's clothing. She was a street vendor for 2 years, but now she has a stall at a local market in the Peruvian region of Yungay.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 installments, she's bought children's clothing for the upcoming Christmas season.

Sra. Clara, 57, is married and has 6 children, all of whom live away from home. She works to help her grandchidren and to pay household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Clara pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, estuvo 2 años vendiendo en un triciclo ambulante y ahora tiene un local ubicado en el Campo ferial del Distrito y Provincia de Yungay.

Con el préstamo recientemente obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 Soles ($ 99) que pagara en 4 cuotas, ha comprado ropa para ñiños(as) para las fiestas navideñas.

Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos que son independientes, trabaja para apoyar a sus nietos y sostener los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet owns a produce stand in the rural area of the Ntungamo District which she has operated for the past 7 years. She is 30 and married with 3 children. She has been a member of her lending group for the past 6 years. At her produce stand, she sells uts, beans, matooke, millet and peas. Produce stands in rural areas are not nearly as prominent as in urban areas for the simple reason that almost everyone is a subsistence farmer and grow whatever they need on their own plot of land.

People in this part of Uganda do not want for food. People will tell you that the food is free, it grows everywhere. Most is planted, but there is plenty of wild mango, papaya, avocado, matooke, jackfruit, etc. With a few chickens, and a goat, you're set. Even the land is shared and Ugandans are also very welcoming. Juliet plans to use her loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Juliet plans to use her loan to pay her children' school fees.

loans.name: Tawa-Kalitu

texts.en: Tawa-Kalitu O. is 34 years old, married with a child, and she hails from Araromin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer with 6 tailoring machines and 5 apprentices. She also sells tailoring materials. She has been in business for past 5 years. She seeks for a loan of $275 to buy more cloth and tailoring material for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman B. is a 55-year-old farmer who owns a small market in the IDP Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. He has run his business since 1995. He sells various kind of goods, beverages and stationery. Elman's store is the only financial source in his family. The income is just enough to cover basic family needs, but not enough to improve his business. He has a very big demand for the products he sells. That’s why he has applied for $900 USD to increase the number of products in his store.

loans.use: To increase the number of products in his store

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
My name is Nazira R., I am married and a mother of ten, including seven boys and three girls. I have lived all my life in Chichawatni, Pakistan and my family currently resides in a three room brick mud house. Due to the high expenses of raising a large family, we have had difficulty meeting the needs of our family in a timely manner. My husband has decided to start a grocery store and I hope this business will yield reasonable profits to help our family situation.

The group members whom I plan to share the loan with include: Shamim and Amna, both of whom want to buy sheep and goats for their livestock trading; Nazira, who will buy wood; and Anweri, who plans to expand her fruit business. These members have learned many things over the course of working together, such as: to work under a mutual agreement, to be responsible, to save, and to receive training on a variety of issues.

loans.use: Start up a grocery store

loans.name: Nimio

texts.es:
Mr. Nimio Cardenas manufactures tiles and panel doors, in the Cinco Pinos area of the city of Chinandega. He has his own shop, equipped with an oven to bake the products and ample space to carry out the drying and hardening process.

He has been devoted to this business for several years, during which he has managed to improve the business and increase production levels. He presently faces financial difficulties and is thus seeking Ceprodel’s support. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for the manufacturing of tiles and panel doors, to be sold to his loyal local clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega el caballero Nimio C. se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de cuarterones y tejas, teniendo su propio establecimiento donde posee un horno para quemar el producto en proceso y además un local amplio donde se lleva a cabo el proceso de secado y endurecimiento.

Se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace varios años, en el cual ha logrado salir adelante llevando a cabo mayores niveles de producción en el negocio. Una de las necesidades que hoy en día atraviesa es la urgencia de acceso al recurso económico por lo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las tejas y cuartones para comercializarlas a sus fieles clientes en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to manufacture tiles and panel doors.

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.ru:
Abdumumin S. lives in the town of Yavan. He works in retail and has a small store where he sells food and groceries. He wants to get a loan to purchase building materials to build a new section adjacent to his store. By increasing the area of his store he will increase the variety of the items. It will also help him increase his profits which help support his family. Abdumumin is 59 years old, married and has five children. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шаимов Абдумумин житель города Яван. Работает в торговле. Имеет небольшой магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит , чтобы купить стройматериалы для постройки новой пристройки к магазину.Увеличив помещение он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет ему увеличить доходы , которые помогут его семье. Абдумумину 59 лет , он женат и имеет 5 детей. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is the wife of A. S. and lives in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning "elder sister.) They have a two-room brick house. She is a housewife while her husband runs a grocery store. Rani baji is applying for a loan so her husband can diversify his grocery line of products.

She has three other members in her loan group. Mumtaz baji and Sugran baji want to use the loan to buy donkey carts. Sakina baji wants a loan for her grocery store.

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for a grocery store and purchase donkey carts

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is the mother of four and grandmother of 14. She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in the province of El Seibo. Ines works as a cleaning lady in both homes and buildings. The government pays her for cleaning large government buildings. Its hard for her to clean sometimes because the buildings are so tall and the windows and walls are very high up.

With this loan, Ines plans to start a small business selling food that she will cook herself. Here, such a business is called a ¨fritura,¨where all sorts of snacks and homemade food are prepared and sold. With the profits from the fritura, Ines hopes to one day buy a stove for her house. She would also love to install a glass window to keep out the flies and mosquitoes. Glass windows are very rare here and quite a luxury, so this is a big dream for her.

loans.use: To start up a small snack stand

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị N. 45 tuổi. Vợ chồng chị có 4 người con, 2 con có việc làm ổn định 2 con đang học đại học. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 1999 vòng vốn ban đầu chị vay 1.000.000đ đầu tư buôn bán trứng vịt và chăn nuôi vịt, sau một vòng vốn vay đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gia đình chị nhân thấy rằng việc chăn nuôi vịt đẻ sẽ đem lại hiệu quả, các vòng vốn sau chị luôn vay vốn ở mức cao vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt và kết hợp mở lò ấp trứng. Hiện tai gia đình chị là nơi chuyên cung cấp vịt giống cho bà con quanh đia phương và các vùng lân cận và cung cấp trứng vịt lộn, bình quân môi tháng gia đình chị thu nhập từ lò ấp 4.000.000đ, 2 con chị đi làm thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ mua trứng ấp.
Thu nhập bình quân. 7.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., aged 45, has 4 children, two of whom have already been working while the other two are in college. Mrs. N. has been a member of TYM Fund since 1999. In the first round, Mrs. N. borrowed 1.000.000 VND to buy and sell ducks’ eggs and raise ducks. After that, Mrs. N. realized that raising ducks and selling their eggs herself would be more profitable, so she has been investing all the loans of the next rounds to breed ducks for eggs. She is currently the supplier of ducks’ eggs for people in her neighborhood and adjacent areas. The business helps Mrs. N. earn about 4.000.000 VND per month. Her two grown-up children make about 3.000.000 VND per month. In the next round of loan, Mrs. N. would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND ($925) to buy more ducks. Her family’s monthly income is 7.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Rukia's Twaomba Salama Group

texts.en:
Rukia is 49 and married with 6 children between 32 and 12 years old. She has been a food and snacks seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a minimum monthly profit from her sales.

Rukia is now looking for a loan to buy more food items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Asha and Hasina.

loans.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es una mujer muy trabajadora y colaboradora, se dedica a la venta de ropa, la que deja al crédito y al contado a sus clientes.  A sus 31 años ella es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales están estudiando y espera que en un futuro sean profesionales.  Trabaja arduamente para seguir creciendo y llegar a tener lo que realmente quiere, que es ampliar su tienda de ropa.  Su esposo Percy la apoya en su negocio y está de acuerdo con los propósitos de Gabriela, por ello ambos hacen de todo por seguir adelante.  Solicitan este préstamo para incrementar la cantidad de prendas, y con ello obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a very collaborative, hard working woman. She sells clothing, cash or credit, to her clients. At 31 years of age, she is the mother of 2 children who are studying and hopes they will become professionals in the future. She works hard to continue growing her business to achieve what it is she really wants: to expand her clothing store. Her husband, Percy, supports her in her business and agrees with Gabriela's intentions for the store, as they both do what they can to succeed. They are soliciting this loan so they can buy more clothing, and with that, increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of clothing she sells.

loans.name: Paula Alicia

texts.es:
Paula es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Paula es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años.sus dos hijos están el  colegio
Paula tiene su negocio de venta de comida: dulces, galatinas, papa rellena, refrescos, helados, ella vende desde hace 10 años.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería insumos para los dulces que va a preparar.
Paula sueña con poner un local  de dulcería .
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. She is 35 years old, is married and has two children ages 13 and 10. Her two children are in school. Paula's business is selling food: she sells candies, stuffed potatoes, soft drinks and ice creams. She has had this business for 10 years. Paula needs a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in ingredients to prepare her candies. Paula dreams with opening a candy store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make candies.

loans.name: Alverdi

texts.en:
Alverdi F., a 50-year-old farmer who lives in a small village in southern Azerbaijan, began raising calves for meat production in 1988 after losing his job. He currently has three calves which he will sell in the spring and a milking cow which provides milk for his wife and four children.

Because it is difficult to meet all of the needs of such a large family, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase four more calves in order to ultimately earn a larger profit. Your generosity can help improve the lives of Alverdi and his family.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta S. is 36 years old and lives at Sunset Boulevard, Dawo, Dapitan City. She has been a single mother of five children since her husband left them in 2000. Three of her children are in school. Now, she finds herself again in a relationship and has been living with him for several years already. Their source of income is a sari-sari store. She has difficulty in raising her children considering the situation, but life must go on for Julieta. Her live-in partner also helps them financially through day labor.

Due to lack of capital, Julieta joined Paglaum MPC last April. She was inclined to be a member due to its benefits given to members. She has made good use of several loans and, at present, she is applying for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods and soft drinks for her sari-sari store. 

Julieta plans to make her sari-sari store into a mini-grocery someday, with a variety of goods for sale. She really strives hard to be able to send all of her children to school and to become fulfilled seeing her children finish their studies and  have comfortable careers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & soft drinks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
A resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia, Mrs. C. is 47 years old. She currently makes a living selling fish in the market area. As another income, she raises pigs in a stall next to her house.

She is married and has eight children; four of them are single and the others are married. To help meet a little more of their family's food expenses, four of her children are employed as garment workers. Her husband Mr. Horng Heun, aged 48, is in the Cambodia Military, as well as being a domestic land trader.

C.'s business is going well, and in order to make the business more successful, she has applied for a loan of $600 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Idibek

texts.ru:
Молодой предприниматель 4 года занимается торговлей.  Меликов Идибек родился 1984 года, женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Он в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе торгует женскими одеждами. В его ассортименте разнообразные национальные платья, штаны, халаты. Закупает он товар у лиц, которые дома шьют. Местом его деятельности является рынок "Корвон" города Душанбе.
Идибек хочет получить займ 1500 сомони для увеличения ассортимента и тем самым увеличить свой товарооборот.
texts.en:
The young entrepreneur has been working in sales for 4 years. Idibek M. was born in 1984. He is married and has one child. He sells women’s clothing at the “Korvon” wholesale market in Dushanbe. His product assortment includes a variety of traditional dresses, trousers and robes. He purchases his products from individuals who sew them at home. His place of business is the “Korvon” market in Dushaben. Idibek would like to take out a $425 (1500 somoni) loan in order to increase his product assortment and increase his inventory. .

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase traditional women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Fisticanu

texts.en: Fisticanu A. lives in Moldova's Calarasi district and has been a carpenter for more than five years. He works alone in a workshop that he built near his home, where he produces high-quality wood items, including tables, doors, windows, chairs and beds. He needs to increase working capital for his workshop, but wood is quite expensive. Microinvest issued a loan to this young carpenter in hopes that he will attract many clients in the future.

loans.use: Increase working capital for his workshop

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 33 years old and lives with his wife and child in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. He has owned a coffee and juice shop for 15 years, and has requested a loan of $2000 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase a fridge and fruits for his shop.

Ziad has been a microcredit client for four years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his coffee shop and start the juice business. He is successful in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ziad decided to work in this line of business due to his experience and his enjoyment of the work. In the future, he plans on changing the décor of his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and fruits for his shop

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El señor Juan José P. tiene ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la reparación de vehículos, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
A su negocio le está haciendo falta herramienta de mejor calidad y más moderna, para darle un mejor servicio a su clientes. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la comprar de las herramienta que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan José P. has been repairing vehicles for more than 8 years. This business is the family´s source of income. His business is in need of better quality and more modern tools so he can provide better service to his customers. However, he does not have the money he needs to buy the tools which are being offered to him at a very good price, which is why he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther B. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. Her husband is a farmer, and they live at Akim Wenchi in the eastern region of Ghana. Esther sells clothing items such as jeans, blouses, brassieres, and ladies' slippers, as well as other items, particularly cosmetics.

To support her household, she has been hawking her cosmetics and other items to her loyal clients in the neighborhood. She says she has found that selling cosmetics is very lucrative, and she therefore wants to expand her cosmetics inventory. This will enable her to make good income to serve the family’s needs. With this loan, she hopes to make a personal trip Accra to purchase her goods in bulk.

Esther belongs to the village bank called ‘Nokwarefo,’ which translates to "Trust."

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics, as well as to purchase jeans, ladies' dresses, and other clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been a clothes seller and has owned a small charcoal store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for three years. She belongs to Ngome North group loan (Group code 2032). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes to sell, so as to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is 40 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 10 and 6. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes to sell

loans.name: Telesila

texts.es:
La señora Telesila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Barrio San Juan, Distrito Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de juanes, ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, desea invertirlo comprando, insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes (plato criollo), asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.

Telesila, se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Telesila F. is a member of the “Shatojinas Loboriosas” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the department of San Martín. She is a 38-year-old married mother of 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her financially.

Her hardworking spirit and her desire to get ahead on her own, which she has always been known for, have helped her start her own business selling juanes (rice, chicken, olives and an egg wrapped in a plantain leaf and parboiled). Her business is located in a well-equipped space, where little by little she has been gaining popularity with customers. She says that her business is now very prosperous.

She still has this same business, which is open nightly. She has been working in this business for years, and she feels very satisfied with what she does.

She would like to invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing ingredients such as sacks of rice, eggs, chickens for her juanes (a Creole dish), as well as cooking utensils so that she can offer high-quality service and replace her old tools. Telesila feels at ease and content with her work, and she gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her realize her hopes and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, eggs, chickens, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M. is 41 years old, married with four children, and presently resides at Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her livestock.

Vilma has been a member of Paglaum MPC since September 2005 and she admitted that, with the help of PMPC Microfinance, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday, be able to send her children to school, and to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Pedirama

texts.en:
Pedirama B., 34, is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Pedirama owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products in the local community. Pedirama has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns ~1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Pedirama joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedirama has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pedirama is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP as business capital. This will be her fourth loan taken from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Benkadi 8  De (Benkadi A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe BENKADI 8 de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture  de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 14 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue à Marka-Coungo et Fana,  après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group BENKADI 8 of the association BENKADI A are all married women who average 35 years of age and 3 children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, the seat of a rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support for carrying out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group is now on its fifth experience with the institution. All the past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, the group members intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment. And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 14 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after the harvests to customers composed of men and women in Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: -Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., age 56, is a widow without any children. She lives with her elderly parents and a sister in Takeo Province. To make a living, she has been engaged in a business of manufacturing Cambodia traditional cake since 1998, typically earning an income of US $1.6 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of this, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to transport her products to her customers at the nearby local markets. By doing so, she will be able to generate additional income and help to raise a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike in order to easily transport her products to the customers

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin L. is a low-income people living in her own family house at the rural area of Kampong Chhnang Province, where she earns her daily profit by selling cupcakes in the local market. She sells her cakes that she makes herself out of her home. She buys cake ingredient on credit from her market suppliers and she returns her income after she finishes selling. She is married with five single children who assist her in making cupcake, while her husband is an employed worker. He is always hired by neighbor to slaughter their animals. Sin L. would like to borrow a loan to purchase more tools for producing cakes and the rest of loan will buy fish at cheapest price to make fish past to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for producing cakes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and married to Wilmer, 30 years old and working in Saudi Arabia as a house carpenter. With the difficulties in life, they have decided to live and work away from each other and accept greater opportunity in other country. They have four children and three of them are already studying.  They are hoping that their sacrifices as parents would be meaningful and be appreciated by their children someday. She hopes to see all of them with good future.

Gloria is engaged in the buy and sell business of vegetables in the market. She buys vegetables in their village very early in the morning and then sells the products in the public market. She is requesting for a loan from KIVA lenders a loan of PHP5,000 that will serve as business capital.  She hopes that her retailing business of vegetables will further expand to be more profitable. Through the said business, Gloria is helping her husband in providing the needs of their family as well as the needs of their children.  She hopes that through her own sacrifices in the business, she could be a productive business woman someday.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 years old Juliana S.  from Mbozi. She is married  with 4  children, between the ages of 7 and 20. Juliana Shas been running a crops  business since 2007. Client’s business is purchasing and selling crops . She works at the business for 9-12  hours per day, 6 days per week Juliana currently earns about 200 USD from her business.
