She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for business . In the future, she plans to open the same business at new location . Juliana thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. (shown here with her young students) is 43 years old and lives and works in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. Her husband Danilo makes a living as a driver, and they have two children.

Marites runs a community pre-school. She also established and manages a canteen located inside the school. On slow days at school, she supplements her income by selling cosmetics and apparel. With all these businesses, she makes close to PHP7,000 a month. 

Marites joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006.  Her profits, when added to loans provided by the cooperative, have helped her improve her school. She has repaid several loans, and has now applied for a new one for PHP26,000. She will use this loan to buy food to sell at her canteen.

Marites hopes to expand her school and improve its reputation so that it is known not just in her community, but in neighboring ones as well.    

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is Christian response to poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the school canteen

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy and her husband Ben are farmers. They live in the village of Murong, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have three children, Vanessa, Lea and Krizel, who are all students.  Nancy and Ben work hard to earn their income and finance their children's educational needs.  They want their children to finish their studies so they will find stable jobs someday.

As farmers, Nancy and Ben want to increase their harvest to earn a higher income. In addition to the farm, Nancy manages a small sari-sari (community-based) store in their village to earn additional income. She wants to improve it but she has inadequate capital. Nancy is seeking to borrow PHP 9,000 from Kiva's lenders to purchase merchandise for her store. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can improve her small business and support her children's education.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel R. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 32 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Maricel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 31-year-old single man. He has owned a wheel shop in his town since 2005. He supports his parents with his business. Ahmad is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a particular wheel machine to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy a wheel machine

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Punto Cuatro, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años tiene instalada en su casa una pequeña bodega donde ofrece abarrotes a sus clientes. Este negocio le provee los ingresos suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia.

El negocio es de mucha ayuda a su comunidad ya que les provee los artículos que necesitan diariamente, el sector donde viven está alejado de la ciudad de Mochumí y para abastecerse usualmente tienen que viajar hasta el mercado de la ciudad.

María desea ampliar su negocio para cumplir con la demanda de sus cientes en esta temporada navideña y de año nuevo pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles para comprar más abarrotes.

María es una joven bastante trabajadora y responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos de su comunidad la estiman mucho.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old; she is single and lives with her parents and brothers in the village of Punto Cuatro in the district of Mochumí, which is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has run a small store out of her house where she sells groceries. This business provides her with enough income for her personal expenses and to help her family. The business is a great help to her community because it supplies products for daily needs. The community is remote and people would otherwise travel to the city of Mochumí to stock up on goods. María would like to grow her business to meet the demands of her clients during the holiday season, but she does not have enough money. This is why she decided to apply for a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternative. She is seeking a loan of 700 new soles to buy grocery products. María is a hard-working and responsible young woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances think highly of her.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries/supplies for store

location.town: Anexo La Piedra - Caserío Punto Cuatro - Mochumí -

loans.name: Los Ganaderos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario los Ganaderos esta integrado por tres personas, las cuales
se conocen desde hace varios años. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que elloe realizan para ganarse la vida diariamente:

el señor Mateo P. tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado con Brenda Yanez, tienen 5 hijos y tres dependen de el, Mateo se dedica a transportar materiales de construccion en su carreta con bueyes, tiene 8 años de realizar este tipo de actividad.
esta solicitando el credito para arreglar su carreta, algun dia desea comprar un carro pick up para que su trabajo sea mas facil y mas rapido.
 
el señor Ramon Antonio A. es un joven de 20 años de edad que acaba de unirse con la joven Eda P., estan esperando su primer bebe, el se dedica a la fabricacion de balcones y puertas de metal, cuando no trabaja la soldadura. Esta solicitando el credito para comprar un buey ya que tiene una carreta y desea utilizarla para jalar o transportar materiales.
 
la señora Maria Victoria L. tiene 36 años de edad vive en union libre con Juan Carlos Aguilar, juntos han procreado 3 hijos a quienes tienen estudiando, Maria se dedica a la panaderia, tiene 7 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, vende su producto en los barrios cercanos a su domicilio. 
Maria vive en el barrio Nueva Esperanza de nacaome valle, esta solicitrando el credito para 
poder agregar fabricar otro tipo de pan dulce a su venta. tiene pensado hacer tortas.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para crecer con sus negocios y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Los Ganaderos" consists of three people, who have known each other for some years. The following describes the different activities that they carry out to earn their daily living: Señor Mateo P. is 36 years old and is married to Brenda Yanez. They have 5 children, and 3 depend on him. Mateo transports construction materials with his wagon and oxen. He has done this type of work for 8 years. He is applying for a loan to repair his wagon. One day he wants to have a pickup truck so that his work will be easier and faster.

Señor Ramon Antonio A. is a young man of 20 who has just united with the young woman Eda P.. They are expecting their first baby. He works in the construction of metal balconies and doors when he is not doing soldering work. He is applying for a loan to buy a ox, since he has a wagon and wants to use it to haul materials.

Señora Maria Victoria L. is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband Juan Carlos Aguilar. Together they have 3 children, who are all in school. Maria works in the baking business. She has done this type of work for 7 years. She sells her products in the neighborhoods close to her home. Maria lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of Nacaome, in the Valle district. She is applying for the loan to be able to add other types of sweetened breads to the products she sells. She is thinking of making cakes. All the group members need the loans to expand their businesses and thus be able to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sand, stone, firewood, iron, bars for soldering, basic ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B., from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria Misamis Oriental, is 56 years old, married, and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail whose revenue comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to invest in expanding the business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 28 years old and single. Jean de Dieu lives with his parents in the Gasabo District in the capital of Rwanda where his business is located. He sells different kinds of products and using a sewing machine. All of these businesses help him to obtain more profits. Some of various products are sugar, sorghum flour, and so on. The sewing machine is used while he is waiting for the customers. Jean de Dieu works so hard for his progress that he earns more profits than one of his family members who is the executive secretary the the center government. They both work for their progress and their families.

Jean de Dieu is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his small shop so that he can obtain more profits. Jean de Dieu is serious man in his activities. His business hours are from 7:00 in the morning to 7:00 in the evening every day except Sunday. With the profits Jean de Dieu expects to earn, he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Purchasing more products for sale

loans.name: Amerlita

texts.en:
Amerlita P. is from the village of Prk. A Bonifacio,Lugait Misamis Oriental.  She is 55 years old, married and has 3 grown children.  Amerlita owns & operates a specialized retail business, selling a variety of goods in the local community.  Amerlita earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amerlita joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Amerlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and now requests 8,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

This loan will be the 2nd from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 
----------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Prk. A, Bonifacio, Lugait, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon R. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Marlon is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling barbecue. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Marlon's ninth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang L. (pictured with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Horn, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them attend school and one weaves silk at home. 

Mrs. Lang L. has been a silk weaver for 5 years. She sells her finished products to middlemen in the village, who then take them to sell at the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been building wooden houses for 5 years as well. Besides these businesses, the couple also grows rice on their rice farm near the village.

Mrs. Lang has received a loan from Kiva before, and is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Teresita joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, a 45-year-old mother of four children in Agusan Del Sur, supports the basic needs of her family through rice farming.  She is now requesting a loan of Php 14,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help support and sustain her business.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: La Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LA SANTA CRUZ, es un grupo familiar. Le pusieron este nombre ya que son originarios de la comunidad “Ranchería La Cruz” de Nacajuca, Tabasco y en ella festejan esta celebración. Son 3 integrantes en el grupo: la señora Vidalia J. O., representante y Cástulo H. G. (esposos), que se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras  y  la señora María Santos V. S. que vende zapatos por catálogo.

El matrimonio de doña Vidalia y don Castulo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, en ello invirtieron su crédito. Tienen su establecimiento en el mercado Pino Suárez ubicado en Villahermosa, capital del Estado y en su domicilio también venden productos en el corredor de su casa. Tienen tres hijos que están estudiando primaria y secundaria.
 
Su sueño a largo plazo es llegar a tener una frutería bien surtida que le permita emplear a su familia y les genere un ingreso fijo y sea un negocio autosuficiente para darles estudios a sus hijos.

Ellos se sienten motivados y agradecidos por que através del crédito otorgado por  Fundación Realidad y KIVA su negocio se va encaminando para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called LA SANTA CRUZ, a family group. They chose this name because they’re natives of the community, “Ranchería La Cruz,” in Nacajuca, Tabasco where they celebrate this festival. There are 3 members of the group, Vidalia J. O. and Cástulo H. G. (married), who sell fruit and vegetables, and María Santos V. S. who sells shoes by catalog.

The married pair, doña Vidalia y don Castulo, sell fruits and vegetables and will invest their loan in this. They have their stall in the Pino Suárez market, located in Villahermosa, capital of the state. They also sell products in their home from the entryway of their house. They have three children that are studying in secondary and primary schools.

Their long-term dream is to have a well-stocked fruit shop that will allow them to employ their family and have a steady income. It would be a self-sufficient business that could pay their children’s tuition. They are motivated and thankful, because thanks to the loan granted by Kiva and Fundación Realidad, their business is moving to meet their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetables and fruit, tomatoes, onions, yucca, pumpkins, shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother with two children, both of whom are in school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

Mary worked as an accounts assistant before starting her own business. She has a beauty shop where she has been selling her products to her neighbors for four years; she has no other sources of income. She would like to buy hair care products and additional cosmetics with the KES 20,000 loan.

Mary faces the challenge of stiff competition from other beauty shops selling the same products. She hopes to open more beauty shops in different areas to diversify the market.

Mary joined Yehu because of the organization's good reputation in the community.

loans.use: to buy more hair products and cosmetics

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem C., 63, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. sells groceries for an income of about $3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about $1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Irade

texts.ru:
Irade Radilas v 1964 qodu. Ona jenata i jivet v qorode Baku. U neyo yest 2 rebonka kotorim 10 i 14 let. Malchik 14 let uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom a dochka 10 let zanimayetysa nacionalnimi tancami. Irade uje 10 let v etom biznese. Eyo babushka toje bila vrachom  i ona s detstva uchila yeyo kak lechit ludey i potom Irade postupila v universitet medicinskiy i nachala rabotat.

Irada nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye aparati dlya raboti. S kajdimk dnem aparatura usovershenstvuyetsya a u neyo staraya aparatura vot pochemu ona xochet kredit chtobi kupit vse novoye chtob kliyenti ostovalis dovolnimi.
texts.en:
Irade was born in 1964. She is married and lives in Baku. She has two children who are ten and fourteen years old. The fourteen-year-old boy goes to school and plays sports. The ten year old girl studies traditional dances. Irade has been in business for ten years. Her grandmother was also a doctor, and, as a child, Irade learned how to treat people from her. Later, Irade entered the medical university and began working. Irade needs 2000 AZN to buy new equipment for work. Every day, medical equipment gets better and better, but she has old equipment. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan to buy new equipment in order to keep her clients satisfied.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medical equipment

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba B. sells doughnuts in Abura. She has received a senior high school education. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a plumber. She has been selling doughnuts for ten years now. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and to educate her children as well.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena L. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Nena is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Nena makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food like "camote" (sweet potato covered with caramelized sugar), bananas and more. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2006, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients for sale

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita D. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old. Nonita is married and has 6 children. Most of her children are adults already but her younger ones still go to school. Nonita works her own rice farm. Nonita has been engaged in her business for over 26 years.

Nonita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Nonita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nonita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nonita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buying fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
El Señor Ariel C. López tiene 22 años es soltero y no tiene  hijos el desde muy pequeño salió de su casa y vive con su tío al cual cuida y apoya económicamente por que el es padre y madre desde muy joven, su tio es un anciano, de casi 80 años que se dedica al cultivo de una pequeña parcela, pero ahora se encuentra muy agotado y además padece de reumatismo y no puede siempre pagarse los medicamentos por lo que Ariel se encarga de comparle sus medicamentos y tratamientos eventualmente; Ariel trabaja actualmente como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama.

El cliente es  la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida, 
 Cabe señalar que el Ariel C. López se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le Comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Ariel C. López, age 22, is single and does not have children. When he was very little he left his house and lived with his uncle. Now he takes care of his uncle and financially supports him. He does this because his uncle has been his mother and his father ever since Areil was very young. His uncle is elderly; his is 80 years old. He devoted himself to cultivating a small parcel of land. But, now he is very worn out. Also, he suffers from rheumatism, and he cannot always pay for his medicine. Ariel takes care of buying his medicine and his occasional treatments. Ariel currently works as a “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for the 2 de Agosto syndicate. He has been an active member for over three years. The service that he offers is profitable because a lot of people request this service for its ease, rapidity, and efficiency. The syndicate has stops and shifts for each affiliate at different points in the Ivirgarzma location. This is his first loan with our institution. He will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle. That way he will be able to provide better service to his customers. It will also allow him to improve his income. He will consequentially improve his quality of life. Ariel C. López came in person to CIDRE's offices to ask for a loan after his coworkers told him of the institution's good credit conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, flour, sugar, salt, gallons of palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: La Sra. Araceli tiene 39 años de edad, ella es conviviente , no cuenta con carga familiar. Tiene casa propia de material  noble semi construida  aun sin acabados, ella esta construyendo poco a poco despues del terremoto. Ella y su conyugue se dedican a la elaboracion de artesania  y vente de bebidas en su domicilio, ellos se dedican a este nogocio hace 10 años. Como toda unidad familiar tienen sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder terminar de contruir su vivienda. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Sra. Araceli, 39, is partnered, with no pressing family obligations.  She owns her own house, a well-constructed semi that is not quite finished.  She has been building it little by little since the earthquake.  She and her partner operate a business making products for sale and selling cold drinks from their house.  They have operated the business for 10 years. Like all families, they have dreams and goals, one of which is to finish building the house.  Sra. Araceli will use this loan for working capital.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Merashid

texts.en:
Merashid is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the children. 

She has operated her business of selling natural juices from home for over four years. Neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Merashid faces a major challenge of seasonality. Duringthe  rainy season the demand for juice is low compared to hot summer season where demands is high. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase a freezer. Merashid decided to join Yehu because of its simple procedures and minimal collateral.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Shodibek

texts.ru: Алиев Шодибек проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Вместе со всей семей занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит мелка - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Shodibek A. lives in the Varzob district.  He is 36 years old, married and has 5 children.  He has a secondary education.  Shodibek and his family are involved in animal husbandry.  He primarily breeds small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for 4 years.  Shodibek is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kairkul's Group

texts.en:
Kairkul A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok. Kairkul is 33 and married. In order to earn money to cover family expenses Kairkul works in the factory and her husband works as a private driver. Together they are bringing up two daughters. Both of them are at school.  

Seven years ago, in order to make additional money for family budget, Kairkul started to cultivate strawberries.  Selling the strawberries she makes 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fertilizers for cultivating strawberries. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for cultivating strawberries

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos R., 39, lives in Reussey Keo District about 10 km from Phnom Penh. She has seven children. One is married and the others are students who also work at various jobs.

She earns a living as a garment worker in the factory.  She started to work in this sector nearly one year ago, and has a proper salary each month to support her family’s daily expenses. Besides working there, she is a local farmer. She has a life partner in her husband who also works as a farmer. 
 
Ruos R. lacks farming supplies, so she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Santiago. Tiene casa propia la cual la adquirio con sus ahorros. Trabaja como albañil por la zona. Requiere el crédito para realizar mejoras a su vivienda. El Sr. Luis está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Luis lives together with his children in the district of Santiago. He owns his house, having purchased it with his own savings. He is a construction worker in his region. He requires the loan to carry out some home improvements. Luis is very grateful for the support that he receives through this loan.

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Tto buy more rock

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is 45 years old, married and supporting her family by fishing and selling fish. She lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. Analie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Analie is borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can fund operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Analie hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen T. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Stephen has a small retail shop business, which he has run for less than one year.
To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Stephen hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale
